query: discrete symmetry Calabi-Yau automorphism group string compactification

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau compactification
concepts.description: Compactification of string theory or M-theory on a Calabi-Yau manifold to obtain lower-dimensional effective field theories preserving some supersymmetry.

concepts.label: center one-form symmetry
concepts.description: A higher-form global symmetry associated with the center of a gauge group, acting on extended objects and potentially breakable by BPS states.

concepts.label: higher-form symmetry
concepts.description: Generalization of global symmetries that act on extended objects of codimension greater than one, commonly arising in supergravity theories.

concepts.label: BPS state
concepts.description: A quantum state in supersymmetric theory saturating a bound set by supersymmetry algebra, preserving fraction of supercharges and appearing as solitons or instantons.

concepts.label: quantum gravity constraint
concepts.description: The requirement that global symmetries must be broken in quantum gravity, arising from black hole thermodynamics and gauge theory considerations.

concepts.label: moduli space
concepts.description: Space of vacuum expectation values of scalar fields in string compactifications parametrizing geometries and couplings of effective field theory.

concepts.label: type IIA string theory
concepts.description: Non-chiral superstring theory with 10-dimensional N=2 supersymmetry, dual to M-theory on a circle and compactifiable on CY3.

concepts.label: M-theory
concepts.description: 11-dimensional supergravity and non-perturbative unification of superstring theories, admitting CY3×S¹ and other geometric compactifications.

concepts.label: supergravity
concepts.description: Supersymmetric extension of general relativity coupling gravity to matter and gauge multiplets while preserving supersymmetry.

concepts.label: vector multiplet
concepts.description: Multiplet in supersymmetric theory containing a gauge field, gaugino fermion, and auxiliary scalar fields transforming as adjoint representation.

concepts.label: symmetry breaking criterion
concepts.description: Quantitative measure evaluating extent to which global symmetries are broken in quantum gravity effective field theories via quantized parameters.

concepts.label: effective field theory
concepts.description: Approximate theory valid at low energy scales capturing infrared physics while abstracting ultraviolet degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: physical scale hierarchy
concepts.description: Ordering of characteristic energy or length scales in physical system: Planck scale, compactification, moduli stabilization, and EFT validity scales.

concepts.label: log Calabi-Yau compactification
concepts.description: A compactification of a Landau-Ginzburg model that yields a variety with logarithmic Calabi-Yau properties, generalizing the standard CY geometry to allow controlled singularities.

concepts.label: Landau-Ginzburg model
concepts.description: A quantum field theoretic model defined by a superpotential W on a target space, often studied via mirror symmetry and D-brane categories.

concepts.label: Fano variety
concepts.description: A smooth projective variety whose anticanonical divisor is ample, providing a rich source of geometric structures and mirror partners.

concepts.label: anticanonical system
concepts.description: The linear system of divisors in the complete linear system |-K_X| for a variety X, whose dimension equals the degree of anticanonicity.

concepts.label: fiber singularity
concepts.description: A singular locus appearing in the fibers of a map; in log CY compactifications, singularities can appear over infinity and at finite points.

concepts.label: covering of projective space
concepts.description: A finite morphism from a variety to projective space ℙⁿ, classified by degree; coverings of degree > 2 are studied for their log CY compactifications.

concepts.label: index one cover
concepts.description: A covering variety whose anticanonical divisor has index (gcd of self-intersection numbers) equal to one, providing a normalization condition.

concepts.label: smooth projective compactification
concepts.description: A smooth algebraic variety obtained by adding a divisor at infinity to a quasi-projective variety while preserving smoothness.

concepts.label: fiber component count
concepts.description: The number of irreducible components in the fiber of a map over a point, conjectured to equal the dimension of the anticanonical system for Fano varieties.

concepts.label: mirror symmetry
concepts.description: A duality between complex-structure moduli of one Calabi-Yau variety and Kähler moduli of its mirror, exchanging symplectic and algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: D-brane category
concepts.description: The derived category of coherent sheaves or Fukaya category appearing in homological mirror symmetry for Landau-Ginzburg models.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau metric
concepts.description: A complete Ricci-flat Kähler metric on a Calabi-Yau manifold satisfying maximal volume growth conditions at infinity.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau cone
concepts.description: A singular Calabi-Yau metric with cone-like geometry at infinity, forming the tangent cone structure.

concepts.label: maximal volume growth
concepts.description: Asymptotic condition on Calabi-Yau metrics where the volume of geodesic balls grows polynomially at maximal rate.

concepts.label: Kähler form
concepts.description: A closed (1,1)-form ω on a complex manifold defining a Hermitian metric and satisfying the Kähler condition ∂∂̄ φ = 0.

concepts.label: weighted blow-up
concepts.description: A compactification technique for manifolds with corners using weighted homogeneous coordinates to resolve geometric singularities.

concepts.label: manifold with corners
concepts.description: A topological space locally modelled on products of closed half-spaces, used to describe boundaries and compactifications.

concepts.label: weighted Hölder space
concepts.description: A Banach space of continuous functions with weighted norm controlling growth at infinity and Hölder-type regularity.

concepts.label: Laplacian mapping properties
concepts.description: Analysis of the Laplacian operator's action on function spaces, determining solvability of elliptic equations.

concepts.label: conical singularity
concepts.description: An isolated singularity of a Calabi-Yau metric locally modelled on a cone product with smooth cross-section.

concepts.label: tangent cone at infinity
concepts.description: The limiting cone geometry obtained from rescaling the Calabi-Yau metric as distance to a basepoint diverges.

concepts.label: Cartesian product cone
concepts.description: A singular space formed as a product of two Calabi-Yau cones, serving as a starting point for metric construction.

concepts.label: smoothing
concepts.description: A resolution of singularities replacing a singular variety with a smooth Calabi-Yau manifold via deformation.

concepts.label: complete metric
concepts.description: A Riemannian metric where every Cauchy sequence converges, ensuring the manifold is metrically complete.

concepts.label: quasi-asymptotically conical geometry
concepts.description: Asymptotic structure where a metric approaches cone geometry but with controlled deviations, allowing transition between cones.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau threefold
concepts.description: A compact complex threefold with trivial canonical bundle and SU(3) holonomy, fundamental to string compactifications.

concepts.label: ordinary CY3
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau threefold in characteristic p>0 with crystalline cohomology exhibiting ordinary reduction structure.

concepts.label: crystalline cohomology
concepts.description: Weil cohomology theory for varieties in characteristic p providing p-adic analogues of singular cohomology.

concepts.label: maximal unipotent monodromy
concepts.description: Local monodromy behavior at boundary points of moduli space where the monodromy matrix becomes maximally unipotent.

concepts.label: Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: Holomorphic triple intersection numbers on CY3 determining string theory superpotential and particle mass matrices.

concepts.label: prepotential
concepts.description: Generating function encoding Yukawa couplings and instanton corrections in the moduli space of CY3.

concepts.label: canonical coordinates
concepts.description: Special coordinates on moduli space of CY3 near MUM point where prepotential has systematic expansion.

concepts.label: integrality property
concepts.description: Property that prepotential and canonical coordinates satisfy p-adic or integral constraints, preserved across mirror duality.

concepts.label: p-adic analogue
concepts.description: Characteristic p version of a complex-analytic or arithmetic structure, extending results to positive characteristic.

concepts.label: CY cohomology
concepts.description: Hodge-theoretic cohomology of Calabi-Yau threefolds with structure constrained by holonomy and Hodge numbers.

concepts.label: Hodge numbers
concepts.description: Topological invariants h^{p,q} characterising the cohomology of a complex manifold; for CY3, h^{1,1} and h^{2,1} are central.

concepts.label: holonomy group
concepts.description: Gauge group describing parallel transport around loops in a Riemannian manifold; for CY3, precisely SU(3).

concepts.label: D₆ dihedral symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete symmetry group of order 12 acting on the complex-structure moduli space of a Calabi-Yau threefold.

concepts.label: holomorphic (3,0)-form
concepts.description: Canonical top holomorphic differential form Ω on a CY3; transforms under automorphisms and enters the superpotential.

concepts.label: Froggatt-Nielsen mechanism
concepts.description: UV completion where large mass hierarchies arise from vector-like fermion masses and small dimensionless couplings to a flavon field.

concepts.label: Kähler triple intersection
concepts.description: Topological invariant κ_{abc} computed as ∫ J_a ∧ J_b ∧ J_c, characterising the Kähler cone geometry of a CY3.

concepts.label: CyTools pipeline
concepts.description: Computational software framework for computing Hodge numbers, Yukawa couplings, and topological invariants of Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: complete intersection Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau threefold defined as the intersection of hypersurfaces in projective space; amenable to systematic classification.

concepts.label: Picard-Fuchs system
concepts.description: Differential equations satisfied by periods of the holomorphic form on a CY3; encodes monodromy and Hodge structure.

concepts.label: monodromy group
concepts.description: Group of transformations of the period lattice induced by loops in the moduli space; constrains mass matrices and flavor symmetries.

concepts.label: automorphism group
concepts.description: Group of biholomorphic self-maps of a CY3; determines which discrete symmetries can act on the moduli space.

concepts.label: Hodge plot
concepts.description: Two-dimensional plot with axes h^{1,1} and h^{2,1}, used to visualize the space of known Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: Tyurin degeneration
concepts.description: A special degeneration of Calabi-Yau manifolds characterized by a smoothing family that preserves certain geometric properties.

concepts.label: Lagrangian torus fibration
concepts.description: A fibration of a Calabi-Yau manifold by special Lagrangian tori, fundamental to SYZ mirror symmetry construction.

concepts.label: Doran-Harder-Thompson conjecture
concepts.description: A conjecture relating mirror symmetry for Calabi-Yau manifolds to mirror symmetry for quasi-Fano manifolds via degenerations.

concepts.label: quasi-Fano manifold
concepts.description: A Fano variety or log Fano variety with boundary divisor; appears as a base or component in degeneration families.

concepts.label: SYZ mirror symmetry
concepts.description: Mirror symmetry construction via dual special Lagrangian torus fibrations, with fiberwise T-duality.

concepts.label: theta function
concepts.description: Holomorphic function on the mirror manifold constructed from the SYZ fibration and Lagrangian torus coordinates.

concepts.label: geometric quantization
concepts.description: Procedure to construct a quantum Hilbert space from a classical symplectic or prequantum manifold via line bundles and sections.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau fibration
concepts.description: A fibration where fibers are Calabi-Yau manifolds and the total space may or may not be Calabi-Yau.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau pair
concepts.description: A klt log pair (X, D) where the log canonical divisor K_X + D is numerically trivial, extending CY geometry to singular settings.

concepts.label: coregularity zero
concepts.description: A condition on log Calabi-Yau pairs restricting the dimension of the space of global sections of multiples of K_X + D to zero, controlling singularity complexity.

concepts.label: Weil index
concepts.description: An invariant measuring the order of a line bundle on a variety, defined via intersection-theoretic properties and related to the algebraic index.

concepts.label: index bound
concepts.description: An upper bound on the index of a variety or pair, constraining how many times a canonical divisor must be taken to become Cartier.

concepts.label: klt Calabi-Yau variety
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau variety with klt (Kawamata log terminal) singularities, allowing mild singularities while maintaining canonical geometry.

concepts.label: generalized log Calabi-Yau pair
concepts.description: An extension of log Calabi-Yau pairs relaxing some conditions while maintaining the property that K_X + D is numerically trivial or semi-ample.

concepts.label: semi-log canonical pair
concepts.description: A pair with singularities along a divisor that generalize normal crossing singularities, allowing overlaps in the singular locus.

concepts.label: isolated log canonical singularity
concepts.description: A log canonical singularity of a variety concentrated at isolated points, typically appearing in degeneration contexts.

concepts.label: Gross-Siebert program
concepts.description: A framework for reconstructing Calabi-Yau varieties and their mirror duals from combinatorial-tropical data, providing a mirror symmetry construction.

concepts.label: Kontsevich-Soibelman program
concepts.description: A program using non-commutative geometry and stability conditions to study mirror symmetry and deformations of Calabi-Yau geometries.

concepts.label: finite group action
concepts.description: An action of a finite group G on a variety X, preserving the geometric structure and inducing a quotient variety X/G.

concepts.label: holomorphic symplectic variety
concepts.description: A smooth projective variety X with a holomorphic symplectic 2-form that is non-degenerate and unique up to scaling.

concepts.label: purely non-symplectic automorphism
concepts.description: An automorphism of a holomorphic symplectic variety that acts trivially on the space of 2-forms; acts via a non-trivial character on (2,0)-forms.

concepts.label: index growth
concepts.description: The asymptotic behavior of the index as dimension increases; can be linear, polynomial, or doubly exponential depending on singularity type.

concepts.label: dimension bound
concepts.description: An upper bound on the Hausdorff dimension or algebraic dimension of a geometric object, constraining its complexity.

concepts.label: projection
concepts.description: A rational map from a variety to a lower-dimensional projective space obtained by restricting hyperplane sections.

concepts.label: singular Calabi-Yau threefold
concepts.description: A threefold with trivial canonical bundle containing isolated singularities; can be deformed to a smooth CY3.

concepts.label: Picard group
concepts.description: The group of divisor classes on a variety; its rank measures the dimension of the space of line bundles modulo linear equivalence.

concepts.label: Picard rank
concepts.description: The rank of the Picard group, indicating the number of independent divisor classes on a variety.

concepts.label: syzygetic structure
concepts.description: The module of syzygies (relations among generators) in a graded algebra or ideal defining a variety.

concepts.label: type II primitive contraction
concepts.description: A birational contraction that contracts a divisor to a point without changing the relative canonical divisor significantly.

concepts.label: exceptional divisor
concepts.description: A divisor whose strict transform under a birational map has codimension ≥2 in the target.

concepts.label: projective plane
concepts.description: The two-dimensional projective space ℙ², parametrizing lines through the origin in 𝐂³.

concepts.label: anticanonical divisor
concepts.description: The negative of the canonical divisor; ample anticanonical divisor characterizes Fano varieties.

concepts.label: klt log pair
concepts.description: A projective log pair with Kawamata log terminal singularities, forming the natural setting for higher-dimensional birational geometry.

concepts.label: absolute coregularity
concepts.description: A numerical invariant measuring the codimension of the non-regular locus in a projective variety or log pair.

concepts.label: fundamental group
concepts.description: The topological invariant π₁(X) classifying homotopy classes of loops on a space X.

concepts.label: abelian subgroup
concepts.description: A subgroup of a group where all elements commute; a normal abelian subgroup is preserved under conjugation.

concepts.label: almost abelianity
concepts.description: Property that the fundamental group admits a normal abelian subgroup of finite index, making the group 'nearly commutative'.

concepts.label: solvable normal subgroup
concepts.description: A normal subgroup whose derived series terminates at the trivial group; generalizes abelian subgroups.

concepts.label: regular locus
concepts.description: The subset of a variety where the defining equations are smooth; the complement is the singular set.

concepts.label: finite index subgroup
concepts.description: A subgroup H of G such that |G : H| < ∞; measures how 'close' H is to G.

concepts.label: projective variety
concepts.description: An algebraic variety admitting a closed embedding into projective space ℂℙⁿ.

concepts.label: higher-dimensional geometry
concepts.description: The study of algebraic varieties of dimension ≥ 3, where singularities and their invariants become central.

concepts.label: birational geometry
concepts.description: Study of algebraic varieties modulo birational equivalence; focuses on rational maps and resolutions of singularities.

concepts.label: Hodge structure
concepts.description: Graded structure on cohomology of algebraic varieties characterised by Hodge decomposition H^n = ⊕_{p+q=n} H^{p,q}.

concepts.label: variation of Hodge structure
concepts.description: Family of Hodge structures over a parameter space that varies compatibly with the family of algebraic varieties.

concepts.label: Kähler moduli
concepts.description: Parameters defining the Kähler form and geometric size of a Calabi-Yau manifold; for CY3 with h^{1,1}=11, there are 11 Kähler moduli.

concepts.label: thrice-punctured sphere
concepts.description: Riemann sphere with three punctures removed, serving as the base space for one-parameter families of Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: geometric realization
concepts.description: Explicit construction of a Calabi-Yau manifold realising a given abstract Hodge structure or family of Hodge structures.

concepts.label: period mapping
concepts.description: Map from the parameter space of a family to the period domain, sending a point to the Hodge structure (periods) of the corresponding fibre.

concepts.label: one-parameter family
concepts.description: Family of Calabi-Yau manifolds parametrised by a single complex variable, with special fibres at punctures of the base curve.

concepts.label: twisted Calabi-Yau algebra
concepts.description: A noncommutative graded algebra satisfying a twisted version of Calabi-Yau duality, generalizing homological properties of commutative CY varieties to the noncommutative setting.

concepts.label: Artin-Schelter regularity
concepts.description: A homological regularity condition for noncommutative graded algebras characterizing finite global dimension and Cohen-Macaulay properties.

concepts.label: graded algebra
concepts.description: An algebra with a vector space decomposition indexed by a monoid (typically ℤ), respecting the algebraic structure grade-by-grade.

concepts.label: locally finite-dimensional algebra
concepts.description: A graded algebra in which each graded piece has finite vector space dimension.

concepts.label: separable algebra
concepts.description: An algebra A such that the multiplication map A ⊗_Z A → A has a separability idempotent, ensuring semi-simple representation theory.

concepts.label: graded radical
concepts.description: The Jacobson radical of a graded algebra, consisting of elements in the intersection of all maximal graded left ideals.

concepts.label: invertible bimodule
concepts.description: A bimodule M over an algebra A such that M ⊗_A M* ≅ A and M* ⊗_A M ≅ A, where M* is the dual bimodule.

concepts.label: tensor algebra
concepts.description: The free algebra on a module, constructed as a graded algebra with concatenation of tensors as multiplication.

concepts.label: GK dimension
concepts.description: Gelfand-Kirillov dimension, a growth-rate invariant measuring how fast the graded pieces of an algebra grow.

concepts.label: noetherian algebra
concepts.description: A graded algebra in which every ascending chain of graded left ideals stabilizes, ensuring finiteness properties.

concepts.label: homological dimension
concepts.description: A measure of the complexity of the module category, typically global dimension or injective dimension of the algebra.

concepts.label: finite global dimension
concepts.description: Property of an algebra where every module has finite projective dimension, bounding the homological complexity.

concepts.label: Cohen-Macaulay property
concepts.description: A homological condition ensuring that modules behave well under duality; in the graded setting, characterizes balanced noncommutative geometry.

concepts.label: dimension of algebra
concepts.description: The Gelfand-Kirillov dimension or graded dimension, classifying algebras into dimension classes (0, 1, 2, etc.).

concepts.label: special Lagrangian submanifold
concepts.description: Calibrated submanifold of a Calabi-Yau manifold that is both volume-minimizing and satisfies a phase condition on the holomorphic form.

concepts.label: Calabi Conjecture
concepts.description: Theorem stating existence of Kähler-Einstein metrics on compact Kähler manifolds with vanishing first Chern class; proved by Yau.

concepts.label: calibrated geometry
concepts.description: Framework where submanifolds are characterized by closed differential forms (calibrations) whose support realizes volume-minimizing cycles.

concepts.label: almost Calabi-Yau manifold
concepts.description: Generalization of Calabi-Yau manifolds useful in special Lagrangian geometry; relaxes or modifies the strict holonomy conditions.

concepts.label: deformation theory
concepts.description: Mathematical framework studying small perturbations and moduli spaces of geometric objects like special Lagrangian submanifolds.

concepts.label: SYZ Conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture that mirror Calabi-Yau 3-folds admit special Lagrangian torus fibrations with dual fibrations exchanging complex and Kähler structures.

concepts.label: special Lagrangian singularity
concepts.description: Singular point or locus of a special Lagrangian submanifold; often modeled on cones with specific geometric constraints.

concepts.label: complex structure deformation
concepts.description: Continuous variation of the complex structure on a manifold, parameterised by moduli; distinct from Kähler deformation.

concepts.label: Monge-Ampère equation
concepts.description: A fully nonlinear elliptic PDE governing the deformation of the Kähler metric; central to the proof of Calabi's conjecture.

concepts.label: symplectic deformation
concepts.description: Continuous variation of the symplectic (Kähler) structure on a manifold, governed by the Monge-Ampère equation.

concepts.label: first Chern class
concepts.description: A topological invariant measuring the curvature of the tangent bundle; vanishes for Calabi-Yau manifolds.

concepts.label: rigid Calabi-Yau threefold
concepts.description: A complex projective threefold with trivial canonical bundle and no infinitesimal deformations, characterized by h¹¹=0.

concepts.label: modularity
concepts.description: Property that the L-function of a geometric object (variety, motive) equals the L-function of an automorphic form, establishing deep arithmetic connections.

concepts.label: good reduction
concepts.description: A variety has good reduction at a prime p if its defining equations reduce to a smooth variety modulo p.

concepts.label: automorphic form
concepts.description: A function on an adèlic group satisfying equivariance and regularity conditions; generates L-functions that encode arithmetic data.

concepts.label: L-function
concepts.description: Analytic function encoding arithmetic invariants of a variety or automorphic representation via Euler products.

concepts.label: discrete symmetry
concepts.description: A finite automorphism group acting on the moduli or cohomology of a variety.

concepts.label: Galois representation
concepts.description: A homomorphism from the absolute Galois group of ℚ to GL_n of a local or global field; lifts to automorphic forms via Langlands correspondence.

concepts.label: toric Calabi-Yau variety
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau threefold with torus action, amenable to combinatorial description via toric polytopes and fan diagrams.

concepts.label: polytope
concepts.description: Convex polytope dual to a toric variety, encodes the combinatorial data of the toric fan and divisor classes.

concepts.label: toric variety
concepts.description: Algebraic variety with torus action, described combinatorially by a fan or polytope.

concepts.label: Duistermaat-Heckman formula
concepts.description: A localization theorem computing integrals over symplectic manifolds by reducing to fixed-point sets of a torus action.

concepts.label: generalized Calabi-Yau manifold
concepts.description: A symplectic manifold with a generalized complex structure extending the classical Calabi-Yau geometry.

concepts.label: Hamiltonian action
concepts.description: An action of a Lie group (typically a torus) on a symplectic manifold preserving the symplectic form via moment maps.

concepts.label: torus action
concepts.description: A continuous action of a torus T^n on a manifold, generating a circle action in each coordinate direction.

concepts.label: localization formula
concepts.description: A technique reducing integration over a manifold to integration over fixed-point loci of a group action.

concepts.label: Duistermaat-Heckman measure
concepts.description: The push-forward of the symplectic measure under the moment map, characterized by a density function.

concepts.label: piecewise polynomial density
concepts.description: A density function on the moment polytope that is polynomial on each chamber, reflecting the combinatorial structure of the action.

concepts.label: moment map
concepts.description: A map μ: M → t* from a symplectic manifold with Hamiltonian group action to the dual of the Lie algebra, encoding the action geometrically.

concepts.label: fixed-point set
concepts.description: The subset of a manifold consisting of points invariant under a group action.

concepts.label: symplectic manifold
concepts.description: A smooth manifold equipped with a closed, non-degenerate differential 2-form (symplectic form) ω.

concepts.label: equivariant cohomology
concepts.description: A cohomology theory for spaces with group actions, accounting for both topological and equivariant structure.

concepts.label: line bundle
concepts.description: A rank-1 holomorphic vector bundle over a complex manifold, characterised by its first Chern class and used to modify the geometry and moduli structure.

concepts.label: Tian-Todorov Theorem
concepts.description: Fundamental result establishing that Calabi-Yau manifolds admit unobstructed deformations, ensuring the smoothness of the moduli space.

concepts.label: unobstructedness
concepts.description: Property that all infinitesimal deformations of a variety can be lifted to actual deformations, implying a smooth moduli space of finite dimension.

concepts.label: obstruction class
concepts.description: Cohomological obstruction in H²(CY, Θ) or similar cohomology group that blocks lifting infinitesimal deformations to finite deformations.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau operator
concepts.description: A Fuchsian differential operator conjecturally determining Q-local systems underlying a Q-VHS with specific Hodge numbers, appearing as Picard-Fuchs operators of families of Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: Fuchsian differential operator
concepts.description: A linear differential operator with regular singular points, whose solutions form local systems in algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: Picard-Fuchs operator
concepts.description: A differential operator satisfied by periods of a family of algebraic varieties, encoding geometric data of the family.

concepts.label: Q-local system
concepts.description: A locally constant sheaf of Q-vector spaces on an algebraic variety, determining a representation of the fundamental group.

concepts.label: Rational curve
concepts.description: An algebraic curve of genus zero on an algebraic variety; enumerated by Gromov-Witten invariants and predicted by mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Period
concepts.description: An integral of a differential form over a homological cycle; periods of a family satisfy differential equations (Picard-Fuchs equations).

concepts.label: Regular singular point
concepts.description: A singularity of a differential equation where solutions grow at most polynomially; characteristic of Fuchsian operators.

concepts.label: type II string theory
concepts.description: A ten-dimensional superstring theory with two supersymmetries, compactifiable on Calabi-Yau threefolds to four dimensions.

concepts.label: NS three-form flux
concepts.description: Background Neveu-Schwarz three-form gauge field sourcing the type IIB superpotential and inducing generalized geometry.

concepts.label: half-flat manifold
concepts.description: Six-dimensional manifold with SU(3) structure that is neither complex nor Ricci-flat; arises as mirror to flux-compactified CY3.

concepts.label: SU(3) structure
concepts.description: Reduction of the SO(6) structure group to SU(3) on a six-manifold, characterized by globally defined two-form and three-form.

concepts.label: generalized Calabi-Yau compactification
concepts.description: String theory compactification on CY3 with background NS flux, described geometrically by generalized complex geometry and deformed Hodge structure.

concepts.label: low-energy effective action
concepts.description: Effective supergravity action obtained by dimensional reduction on the compactification manifold, valid at scales below the string scale.

concepts.label: geometric compactification
concepts.description: Consistent reduction of higher-dimensional string theory by internal compactification on a specified closed manifold.

concepts.label: pre-Calabi-Yau category
concepts.description: A differential graded category equipped with a compatible homotopy inner product that encodes homological mirror symmetry data.

concepts.label: dg quiver
concepts.description: A directed graph whose edges are differential graded modules, forming the underlying structure of a dg category.

concepts.label: homotopy transfer theorem
concepts.description: A classical result stating that algebraic structures can be transferred along homotopy equivalences, preserving structural operations up to homotopy.

concepts.label: minimal model
concepts.description: A simplest representative of a homotopy type with trivial differential, obtained by successively eliminating acyclic subcomplexes.

concepts.label: quasi-isomorphism
concepts.description: A morphism of chain complexes inducing isomorphism on homology; represents equivalence in the derived category.

concepts.label: pre-Calabi-Yau morphism
concepts.description: A dg functor between pre-Calabi-Yau categories that preserves the homotopy inner product structure.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau structure
concepts.description: A non-degenerate symmetric bilinear form on a dg algebra or category satisfying cyclicity and self-duality conditions.

concepts.label: homological mirror symmetry
concepts.description: A duality exchanging the derived Fukaya category of a symplectic manifold with the derived category of coherent sheaves on its mirror.

concepts.label: differential graded algebra
concepts.description: An associative algebra with a compatible differential satisfying the Leibniz rule; foundation for homological algebra.

concepts.label: homotopy equivalence
concepts.description: An equivalence relation on chain complexes weaker than isomorphism; two complexes are homotopy equivalent if there exist morphisms whose composites are homotopic to identities.

concepts.label: isomorphism dg quiver
concepts.description: A dg functor between quivers that induces bijections on vertex and edge spaces with invertible differentials.

concepts.label: acyclic subcomplex
concepts.description: A subcomplex with trivial homology, which can be contracted to zero without changing the homotopy type.

concepts.label: quasi-inverse
concepts.description: A morphism whose left and right compositions with another morphism are homotopic to identities; inverse in derived/homotopy category.

concepts.label: properadic calculus
concepts.description: Formal framework for operads and properads allowing systematic study of homotopical algebraic structures and their deformations.

concepts.label: finite p-group
concepts.description: A finite group whose order is a power of a prime p.

concepts.label: conjugacy class
concepts.description: The set of all elements in a group that are conjugate to a given element.

concepts.label: group order
concepts.description: The cardinality of a finite group, denoted |G|.

concepts.label: divisibility relation
concepts.description: A number-theoretic constraint stating that one integer divides another without remainder.

concepts.label: conjugacy class size
concepts.description: The cardinality of a conjugacy class in a group.

concepts.label: element
concepts.description: A member of a group structure.

concepts.label: symplectic modular group
concepts.description: Discrete group Sp(2g,ℤ) acting on the period matrix of a Calabi-Yau threefold; encodes monodromies in moduli space.

concepts.label: CP symmetry
concepts.description: Charge-parity discrete symmetry that reverses spatial coordinates and charges; identified with an outer automorphism of the symplectic modular group.

concepts.label: outer automorphism
concepts.description: Symmetry transformation of a group that cannot be realized by conjugation; lies outside the inner automorphism group.

concepts.label: semidirect product group
concepts.description: Extension of a normal subgroup by another group via a homomorphism; used here to enlarge the symplectic modular group with CP.

concepts.label: flux
concepts.description: Quantized field strength wrapped on non-trivial cycles of the compactification space; sources spontaneous symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: spontaneous CP violation
concepts.description: Breaking of CP symmetry by the vacuum state rather than the Lagrangian, realized through flux contributions to the effective action.

concepts.label: R-symmetry
concepts.description: Global continuous or discrete symmetry that rotates supercharges and scalar fields in supersymmetric theories.

concepts.label: large complex structure regime
concepts.description: Region of the moduli space where one or more complex structure moduli are large, enabling classical geometric analysis.

concepts.label: endomorphism
concepts.description: A morphism from a projective space or variety to itself, subject to conjugation action by automorphisms.

concepts.label: projective linear group
concepts.description: The group PGL acting by conjugation on the space of endomorphisms of projective space.

concepts.label: finite subgroup
concepts.description: A finite subgroup of the projective linear group that can be realized as the automorphism group of some endomorphism.

concepts.label: conjugation action
concepts.description: The natural action of PGL on endomorphisms via conjugation, inducing the stabilizer group structure.

concepts.label: fixed-point algorithm
concepts.description: A computational method for determining automorphism groups by analyzing fixed points, extended to higher-dimensional endomorphisms.

concepts.label: degree of endomorphism
concepts.description: The algebraic degree of a morphism, which provides an explicit bound on the size of its automorphism group.

concepts.label: rationality problem
concepts.description: The question of whether an endomorphism with a given automorphism group can be defined over a base field.

concepts.label: invariant theory
concepts.description: The mathematical framework studying properties and structures invariant under group actions on varieties.

concepts.label: non-relativistic string theory
concepts.description: String theory framework in the non-relativistic limit where particle velocities are much smaller than the speed of light.

concepts.label: internal geometry
concepts.description: The compact extra-dimensional space (e.g., Calabi-Yau manifold) in string compactification.

concepts.label: Torsion cohomology
concepts.description: Non-trivial torsion elements in the cohomology ring of a manifold, not supported by smooth differential forms.

concepts.label: Non-Abelian discrete symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete gauge symmetry group that is non-commutative, arising from the cohomological structure of the compactification space.

concepts.label: Cup product
concepts.description: Multiplicative operation on cohomology classes that combines two forms to produce a higher-degree cohomology element.

concepts.label: Z₂ × Z₂ action
concepts.description: Fixed-point-free action of the Klein four-group on a manifold, used to construct the CY quotient by identifying orbifold points.

concepts.label: Heisenberg discrete group
concepts.description: Non-Abelian discrete group with Heisenberg-type commutation relations; realized as the discrete gauge symmetry of the effective theory.

concepts.label: Elliptic curve product
concepts.description: Product of three elliptic curves forming a six-torus; quotient by discrete action yields the CY threefold.

concepts.label: Cohomology ring structure
concepts.description: Multiplicative structure of cohomology classes under cup product, determining topological constraints on gauge symmetries.

concepts.label: Second cohomology torsion
concepts.description: Torsion elements in H²(CY3; ℤ) whose cup product generates non-trivial elements in higher cohomology.

concepts.label: Fourth cohomology
concepts.description: Top-degree cohomology group H⁴(CY3; ℤ) where torsion cup products from H² map non-trivially.

concepts.label: Global definition
concepts.description: Property that the CY manifold is defined globally without orbifold singularities or patching issues.

concepts.label: Yukawa texture
concepts.description: Pattern of zeros and relative magnitudes in Yukawa coupling matrices that determines fermion mass hierarchies and mixing angles.

concepts.label: Pati-Salam symmetry
concepts.description: Grand unified gauge group SU(4)×SU(2)_L×SU(2)_R that unifies quarks and leptons, broken to the standard model at high scales.

concepts.label: Family symmetry
concepts.description: Horizontal symmetry acting on fermion flavor generations; constrains Yukawa couplings and generates mass texture predictions.

concepts.label: Texture zero
concepts.description: Vanishing entry in the Yukawa matrix arising from symmetry principles, yielding predictive mass and mixing relations.

concepts.label: String unification
concepts.description: Unified theoretical framework deriving the gauge group and Yukawa couplings from string theory compactification.

concepts.label: Fermion mass hierarchy
concepts.description: Exponential suppression of lighter generation masses relative to the top quark, explained by texture zeros and coupling hierarchies.

concepts.label: CKM mixing matrix
concepts.description: Unitary matrix parametrizing quark flavor mixing in the weak interaction; predicted by Yukawa texture models.

concepts.label: Non-renormalisable operator
concepts.description: Higher-dimension effective operator in string-derived models that generates Yukawa couplings after symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Gauge symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Spontaneous reduction of a gauge group to a subgroup, implementing the link between high-scale unification and low-energy effective theory.

concepts.label: Supersymmetric standard model
concepts.description: Minimal supersymmetric extension of the standard model (MSSM); the effective theory below 10^16 GeV in unified models.

concepts.label: Charged fermion mass
concepts.description: Empirical mass eigenvalues of quarks and leptons; fitted by Yukawa texture predictions.

concepts.label: Chi-squared fit
concepts.description: Numerical procedure testing whether a theoretical model reproduces experimental fermion mass and mixing data; quantifies texture viability.

concepts.label: Heterotic string
concepts.description: Hybrid string theory combining left-moving fermionic string with right-moving bosonic string, with compactified internal dimensions.

concepts.label: Berglund-Hubsch type
concepts.description: Special class of Calabi-Yau manifolds constructed as hypersurfaces in weighted projective spaces via involution actions.

concepts.label: Batyrev-Borisov construction
concepts.description: Combinatorial approach to CY manifolds using reflexive polytopes and mirror pairs determined by lattice data.

concepts.label: SCFT
concepts.description: Superconformal field theory with specified central charge used in Heterotic compactification.

concepts.label: Gepner construction
concepts.description: Exactly solvable method for Heterotic string models using products of minimal models with total central charge c=22.

concepts.label: vertex operator
concepts.description: Operator representing physical states in string theory, constructed as cohomology of Borisov differentials.

concepts.label: Borisov differential
concepts.description: Differential operator on reflexive polytope lattice points whose cohomology yields heterotic vertex operators.

concepts.label: cohomology
concepts.description: Algebraic topological invariant measuring sheaf sections and geometric deformations, used to construct physical states.

concepts.label: holomorphic vector bundle
concepts.description: Stable holomorphic sheaf over a Calabi-Yau manifold satisfying slope-stability; defines the gauge sector in heterotic compactifications.

concepts.label: heterotic string compactification
concepts.description: Dimensional reduction of E₈×E₈ or Spin(32)/ℤ₂ heterotic string theory on a Calabi-Yau 3-fold with holomorphic vector bundle.

concepts.label: GL(12)/D₆ polytope
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau threefold with Hodge diamond h¹¹=17, h²¹=20, and Kähler surface (K·S)=37, exhibiting dihedral D₆ symmetry acting on its moduli space.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau automorphism
concepts.description: A biholomorphic self-map of a Calabi-Yau threefold; can realize discrete flavor symmetries acting non-Abelianly on the chiral spectrum.

concepts.label: anomaly-mediated supersymmetry breaking
concepts.description: A mechanism where supersymmetry breaking in the hidden sector is communicated to the visible sector through anomalies in the dilatation current.

concepts.label: slepton mass problem
concepts.description: The challenge in AMSB models that sleptons acquire tachyonic masses; resolved here by introducing a mixed-anomaly-free U(1) symmetry.

concepts.label: flavor-changing neutral current
concepts.description: Rare processes mediated by neutral gauge bosons or scalars; constrained by requiring specific Yukawa textures that suppress such interactions.

concepts.label: texture analysis
concepts.description: Computational methods for extracting features and descriptors from images to quantify spatial variation of pixel intensity and surface characteristics.

concepts.label: visual texture
concepts.description: Spatial patterns of intensity variation in digital images that convey information about shape, content, and surface properties.

concepts.label: statistical texture methods
concepts.description: Texture analysis approaches based on statistical properties of pixel intensities and their distributions, such as first-order and second-order statistics.

concepts.label: structural texture methods
concepts.description: Texture analysis techniques based on identifying and analyzing the spatial arrangement and relationships of texture primitives or texels.

concepts.label: model-based texture methods
concepts.description: Texture analysis approaches that fit probabilistic or generative models to texture data to capture its underlying structure.

concepts.label: transform-based texture methods
concepts.description: Texture analysis techniques using mathematical transforms such as Fourier, wavelet, or Gabor filters to decompose texture into frequency or spatial-frequency components.

concepts.label: combinational texture methods
concepts.description: Hybrid texture analysis approaches that integrate multiple method categories to improve discrimination performance and robustness.

concepts.label: texture descriptor
concepts.description: Compact numerical representation or feature vector that encodes essential characteristics of texture for comparison and classification.

concepts.label: object recognition
concepts.description: Computer vision task of identifying and classifying objects within images using extracted features and learned models.

concepts.label: surface defect detection
concepts.description: Application of texture analysis to identify surface irregularities, flaws, or anomalies in manufactured or natural materials.

concepts.label: medical image analysis
concepts.description: Application of image processing and texture analysis techniques to diagnostic imaging for disease detection and tissue characterization.

concepts.label: texture classification
concepts.description: Machine learning task of assigning texture images to predefined categories based on extracted texture descriptors.

concepts.label: image classifier
concepts.description: Statistical or machine learning model that assigns images or image regions to discrete classes based on learned decision boundaries.

concepts.label: texture robustness
concepts.description: Resistance and invariance of texture analysis methods to image degradations and transformations such as noise, rotation, and scaling.

concepts.label: texture benchmark dataset
concepts.description: Standardized collection of annotated texture images used for training, validation, and comparative evaluation of texture analysis methods.

concepts.label: hypermultiplet moduli space
concepts.description: The quaternionic-Kähler space parametrizing scalar fields in the hypermultiplet sector of type II or heterotic compactifications.

concepts.label: K3 surface
concepts.description: A compact complex 2-dimensional Kähler surface with trivial canonical bundle and b₂=22, serving as heterotic compactification base.

concepts.label: twistor space
concepts.description: A six-dimensional complex space fibred over four-dimensional spacetime, encoding quaternionic-Kähler geometry via holomorphic data.

concepts.label: double scaling limit
concepts.description: A limit where both type II and heterotic string couplings approach zero, rendering both theories classical and enabling moduli map comparison.

concepts.label: heterotic-type II duality
concepts.description: Equivalence between heterotic strings on K3×T² and type II strings on a Calabi-Yau threefold, preserving the hypermultiplet moduli space.

concepts.label: worldsheet instanton corrections
concepts.description: Non-perturbative contributions to heterotic string amplitudes from instantons wrapping worldsheet curves, breaking holomorphicity away from limits.

concepts.label: automorphic forms
concepts.description: Functions on symmetric spaces invariant under arithmetic groups; in this context, SO(4,n,Z)-invariant forms generated by Borcherds lifts.

concepts.label: SO(4,n,Z) arithmetic group
concepts.description: The integer subgroup of the orthogonal group SO(4,n), acting discretely on the associated symmetric space and preserving automorphic form invariance.

concepts.label: moduli map
concepts.description: The explicit correspondence between heterotic and type II moduli fields, computable in the double scaling limit and encoded in twistorial form.

concepts.label: D₆-invariant Yukawa texture
concepts.description: Pattern of 26 non-vanishing Yukawa couplings surviving D₆ symmetry constraints out of the full set, creating a highly restricted coupling structure.

concepts.label: lepton mixing angle
concepts.description: Parameter θ₁₃ characterising the mixing between neutrino generations; potentially constrained by Calabi-Yau monodromy structure.

concepts.label: N=1 compactification
concepts.description: Reduction of 10-dimensional heterotic string theory to 4-dimensional N=1 supersymmetry via Calabi-Yau threefold compactification.

concepts.label: heterotic string vacua
concepts.description: Four-dimensional supersymmetric solutions of the SO(32) heterotic string obtained by compactification on Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: complex structure modulus
concepts.description: Parameter controlling the shape and geometry of the Calabi-Yau manifold; Yukawa couplings generically depend on these moduli.

concepts.label: D₆-invariant period
concepts.description: Period integral of the holomorphic (3,0)-form Ω that is symmetric under the D₆ action, forming the input data for the superpotential.

concepts.label: quark-lepton mass hierarchy
concepts.description: Observed spectrum of fermion masses and mixing angles; reproduced by Yukawa coupling textures constrained by discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: bundle-valued differential form
concepts.description: Differential form taking values in the cohomology of a holomorphic bundle; related to ambient space forms for computational evaluation of Yukawa integrals.

concepts.label: matter field Kähler potential
concepts.description: Kähler potential for matter field kinetic terms in the effective action; can be evaluated without explicit Ricci-flat metric knowledge under large gauge flux localization.

concepts.label: Type IIA superstring
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional superstring theory with two supersymmetries of opposite chirality; low-energy limit is ten-dimensional Type IIA supergravity.

concepts.label: strong coupling dynamics
concepts.description: Physical phenomena and dualities that govern the behavior of a quantum field theory or string theory in the regime where the coupling constant is large.

concepts.label: heterotic-Type IIA duality
concepts.description: Conjectured equivalence between heterotic string theory and Type IIA superstring theory relating their strong and weak coupling limits.

concepts.label: S-duality
concepts.description: Duality relating strong and weak coupling regimes of a quantum field theory or string theory, exchanging coupling constant g↔1/g.

concepts.label: supersymmetry
concepts.description: Symmetry relating bosonic and fermionic degrees of freedom; fundamental symmetry principle of superstring theories.

concepts.label: dimensional analysis
concepts.description: Study of how physical theories and dualities behave in different spacetime dimensions and under compactification to lower dimensions.

concepts.label: D2 branes
concepts.description: Two-dimensional extended objects in string theory whose world-volume supports a three-dimensional supersymmetric field theory.

concepts.label: D6 branes
concepts.description: Six-dimensional extended objects in string theory that serve as a background on which lower-dimensional branes can be localized.

concepts.label: phase structure
concepts.description: Qualitatively distinct regimes of the D2-D6 system as functions of energy scale and brane number, each characterized by different geometric and field-theoretic properties.

concepts.label: world-volume theory
concepts.description: Effective field theory living on the spatial extent of a brane, derived from open strings ending on that brane.

concepts.label: near-horizon geometry
concepts.description: Spacetime geometry obtained as the limit of metric near a stack of branes, conjectured to be dual to the brane world-volume theory.

concepts.label: AdS₄ geometry
concepts.description: Four-dimensional anti-de Sitter spacetime with negative cosmological constant, arising as the IR limit in the D2-D6 system.

concepts.label: fibered geometry
concepts.description: A spacetime structure where AdS₄ fibers over a compact base space, parametrized by moduli inherited from the brane configuration.

concepts.label: IR geometry
concepts.description: The spacetime geometry describing the infrared (low-energy) limit of a brane system, governing long-range interactions.

concepts.label: duality
concepts.description: A correspondence relating different physical descriptions (geometric versus field-theoretic) of the same quantum system.

concepts.label: NS5 branes
concepts.description: Solitonic five-dimensional objects in string theory that, when located at D6 branes, produce a phase structure analogous to the D2-D6 system.

concepts.label: string unification scale
concepts.description: The energy scale Lambda_H ~ 5 × 10^17 GeV at which gauge couplings converge in weakly coupled heterotic string theory, differing from the MSSM unification scale.

concepts.label: MSSM unification scale
concepts.description: The energy scale Lambda_U ~ 2.5 × 10^16 GeV at which the three Standard Model gauge couplings converge in the Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model under intermediate scale desert scenarios.

concepts.label: optical unification
concepts.description: A mechanism proposed by Giedt where intermediate-scale MSSM-charged exotic particles act as a diverging lens on running couplings, creating a virtual image of the string unification point between the string and exotic mass scales.

concepts.label: exotic particles
concepts.description: Intermediate-scale MSSM-charged particles whose renormalization group contributions modify the running of gauge couplings to bridge the hierarchy between electroweak and string unification scales.

concepts.label: gauge coupling running
concepts.description: Energy-scale dependence of gauge coupling constants driven by renormalization group evolution, determining the convergence point of unified couplings.

concepts.label: intermediate scale desert
concepts.description: A scenario in particle physics where no new physics appears between the electroweak scale and the GUT unification scale, allowing standard MSSM unification.

concepts.label: weakly coupled heterotic string
concepts.description: A regime of heterotic string theory where the string coupling constant is small, enabling perturbative calculations of gauge coupling predictions.

concepts.label: string phenomenology
concepts.description: The field studying connections between string theory predictions and observable particle physics, including gauge unification and matter spectra.

concepts.label: renormalization group equation
concepts.description: Differential equations describing the energy-dependence of coupling constants and masses in quantum field theory, central to predicting coupling convergence.

concepts.label: unified gauge coupling
concepts.description: A single value to which distinct gauge couplings converge at a unification scale in grand unified theories, determining the strength of electroweak and strong interactions at high energy.

concepts.label: Yukawa unification
concepts.description: Scenario where Yukawa couplings for different fermion families are equal or related by a discrete symmetry, typically arising in GUT theories.

concepts.label: GUT theory
concepts.description: Grand unified theory with a unified gauge group (SU(5), SO(10), etc.) at high scales, breaking to the Standard Model at lower scales.

concepts.label: Wilson line breaking
concepts.description: Mechanism for breaking gauge symmetry via non-trivial holonomy of gauge connections around non-contractible cycles of the compactification manifold.

concepts.label: matter spectrum
concepts.description: Set of light fermions and scalars emerging after gauge bundle breaking and Wilson line reduction, determining low-energy particle content.

concepts.label: Einstein-Maxwell equations
concepts.description: Coupled system of Einstein's field equations with Maxwell's electromagnetism, describing gravity interacting with electromagnetic fields.

concepts.label: Stationary-axially symmetric spacetime
concepts.description: Spacetime geometry possessing both time-translation and rotational symmetry about a spatial axis, reducing the field equations to two-dimensional problems.

concepts.label: Conserved currents
concepts.description: Currents satisfying continuity equations ∂·J=0 that arise from Noether's theorem, associated with continuous symmetries of the action.

concepts.label: Affine symmetry algebra
concepts.description: Infinite-dimensional Kac-Moody algebra structure characterizing level-k extensions of finite-dimensional Lie algebras in string theory.

concepts.label: Ehlers transformation
concepts.description: A generalized symmetry transformation relating solutions of stationary-axisymmetric Einstein-Maxwell equations without electromagnetic field.

concepts.label: Harrison transformation
concepts.description: A symmetry transformation of Einstein-Maxwell equations that generates new solutions from known ones, rotating between gravitational and electromagnetic degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: Infinite dimensional symmetry
concepts.description: A symmetry algebra of infinite dimension, typically appearing in integrable systems and string theory, allowing an infinite number of conserved charges.

concepts.label: Two-dimensional reduction
concepts.description: Dimensional reduction technique reducing higher-dimensional field equations to two-dimensional ones by imposing symmetry constraints.

concepts.label: F-theory
concepts.description: Non-perturbative formulation of type IIB string theory on an elliptically fibered Calabi-Yau variety, dual to heterotic string.

concepts.label: Heterotic little string theory
concepts.description: 6D (1,0) quantum field theory obtained from heterotic string theory via F-theory geometric engineering, characterized by flavor symmetries and Coulomb branch structure.

concepts.label: elliptic K3 fibration
concepts.description: Fibration structure where the fiber over each point in the base is a K3 surface, determining the 6D flavor group in F-theory/Heterotic duality.

concepts.label: elliptic fibration
concepts.description: Fibration where the generic fiber is an elliptic curve; distinct structures yield inequivalent T-dual LST models.

concepts.label: Coulomb branch
concepts.description: Moduli space of scalar vacuum expectation values for gauge fields in 6D (1,0) theories; its dimension is a key consistency check for LST dualities.

concepts.label: 2-group structure
concepts.description: Algebraic structure encoding the interplay between 0-form and 1-form symmetries in 6D quantum field theories.

concepts.label: Kulikov degeneration
concepts.description: Singular degeneration point of elliptic K3 fibration where the K3 fiber becomes singular; locus where LST is realized.

concepts.label: F-theory/Heterotic duality
concepts.description: Equivalence between F-theory on elliptically fibered CY3 and heterotic string theory, relating non-compact geometries to 6D LSTs.

concepts.label: T-duality
concepts.description: Duality relating inequivalent elliptic fibration structures on the same CY base, generating networks of dual LST models.

concepts.label: non-geometric heterotic regime
concepts.description: Heterotic string regime without conventional perturbative description, accessed via non-compact F-theory geometries and geometric engineering.

concepts.label: Weil-Petersson metric
concepts.description: Kähler metric on the moduli space of complex structure deformations, enabling computation of normalized Yukawa couplings without explicit Ricci-flat metric.

concepts.label: moduli space of complex structure
concepts.description: Parameter space parametrizing inequivalent complex-structure deformations of a Calabi-Yau manifold.

concepts.label: Kodaira-Spencer map
concepts.description: Differential geometric map relating tangent vectors in moduli space to infinitesimal complex-structure deformations of the manifold.

concepts.label: standard embedding
concepts.description: Heterotic string compactification in which the spin connection is identified with the gauge connection on the tangent bundle.

concepts.label: harmonic representative
concepts.description: Explicit cocycle representative of a cohomology class used to compute Yukawa couplings numerically.

concepts.label: machine-learned Ricci-flat metric
concepts.description: Approximate Ricci-flat metric constructed via machine learning methods using harmonic representatives to compute Yukawa couplings.

concepts.label: normalized Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: Yukawa coupling rescaled by the Weil-Petersson metric to account for moduli-space geometry without requiring the full Ricci-flat metric.

concepts.label: Fermat quintic
concepts.description: Explicit Calabi-Yau threefold defined as a degree-5 hypersurface in projective 4-space; a test case for Yukawa coupling calculations.

concepts.label: Tian-Yau manifold
concepts.description: An explicit Calabi-Yau threefold example used to verify Yukawa coupling computation methods.

concepts.label: multi-reference alignment
concepts.description: Signal recovery problem where observations are corrupted by unknown group actions and additive noise.

concepts.label: bispectrum
concepts.description: Third-order cyclic invariant tensor used for signal recovery; Fourier-domain triple moment statistic.

concepts.label: invariant tensor
concepts.description: Tensor quantity that remains unchanged under group actions; fundamental tool for orbit characterization.

concepts.label: signal orbit
concepts.description: Set of all images of a signal under the action of a group; uniquely identifies the signal up to group symmetry.

concepts.label: reflection
concepts.description: Non-abelian group element that reverses orientation; prevents tensor diagonalization in Fourier basis.

concepts.label: Fourier basis
concepts.description: Orthonormal basis of complex exponentials; standard tool for diagonalizing cyclic group actions.

concepts.label: moment tensor
concepts.description: Statistical object encoding correlations of signal measurements; third-order version used for recovery.

concepts.label: sample complexity
concepts.description: Minimum number of measurements required to recover a signal with high probability.

concepts.label: frequency marching
concepts.description: Computational algorithm for signal recovery via iterative Fourier-based estimation; impractical for dihedral case.

concepts.label: optimization algorithm
concepts.description: Numerical method for minimizing objective function; shown effective for dihedral MRA recovery.

concepts.label: generic signal
concepts.description: Signal whose orbit under group action is uniquely determined by a minimal set of invariants.

concepts.label: circular shift
concepts.description: Cyclic group action corresponding to time/phase rotation; natural symmetry in cyclic MRA.

concepts.label: standard representation
concepts.description: Natural linear representation of dihedral group acting on d-dimensional Euclidean space.

concepts.label: tensor diagonalization
concepts.description: Decomposition of moment tensor into orthogonal eigenbasis; enabled by abelian but blocked by dihedral symmetry.

concepts.label: Lorentz group
concepts.description: The group of spacetime symmetries in 4D, generated by parity inversion and time reversal, comprising four topologically separate components.

concepts.label: Parity inversion
concepts.description: Discrete spacetime symmetry that reverses spatial coordinates; a generator of the Lorentz group.

concepts.label: Time reversal symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete spacetime symmetry that reverses the direction of time; a generator of the Lorentz group.

concepts.label: Dirac fermion representation
concepts.description: Quantum field theory representation of fermions that is doubled by mirror symmetry, creating a chiral structure.

concepts.label: Mirror particle sector
concepts.description: New sector of particles introduced by mirror symmetry, constituting a shadow copy of the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Chiral anomaly
concepts.description: Quantum violation of classical chiral symmetry at the loop level; constrained by mirror symmetry in extended theories.

concepts.label: Beyond Standard Model physics
concepts.description: Extensions of the Standard Model incorporating new symmetries and sectors such as mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Topological transition
concepts.description: Quantum phase transition changing topological properties; discussed as an implication of mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Neutrino physics
concepts.description: Study of neutrino properties and interactions; affected by mirror symmetry extensions in BSM models.

concepts.label: Dark energy
concepts.description: Mysterious component driving cosmic acceleration; proposed to have connections to mirror symmetry in extended theories.

concepts.label: non-invertible symmetry
concepts.description: A symmetry operation that cannot be inverted; obtained by gauging a subgroup of a discrete symmetry to create constrained quantum operations.

concepts.label: nearest neighbor interaction
concepts.description: Texture pattern where Yukawa couplings couple only adjacent generations, producing off-diagonal suppression in mass matrices.

concepts.label: gauging
concepts.description: Procedure of promoting a global symmetry to a local symmetry by introducing gauge fields.

concepts.label: subgroup
concepts.description: A subset of a group that forms a group under the same operation; essential for constructing non-invertible symmetries.

concepts.label: conventional symmetry
concepts.description: Invertible symmetry satisfying standard group axioms; contrasted with non-invertible symmetries.

concepts.label: superpotential
concepts.description: Holomorphic function in supersymmetric theory containing Yukawa coupling terms that determine fermion interactions.

concepts.label: fermion mass matrix
concepts.description: Matrix encoding Yukawa couplings and determining physical fermion masses and mixing angles via diagonalization.

concepts.label: 11-dimensional supermembrane
concepts.description: Two-dimensional extended object in eleven-dimensional supergravity theory; fundamental constituent of M-theory.

concepts.label: string-membrane duality
concepts.description: Conjectured equivalence between heterotic string theory in seven dimensions and an 11-dimensional supermembrane, where each is a soliton of the other.

concepts.label: soliton
concepts.description: Non-perturbative extended object solution carrying topological charge; in string theory, relates fundamental and composite objects.

concepts.label: 11-dimensional fivebrane
concepts.description: Five-dimensional extended object in eleven-dimensional supergravity; predicted dual to heterotic string under string-membrane duality.

concepts.label: worldsheet action
concepts.description: Two-dimensional action functional describing the dynamics of string worldsheet embeddings in target spacetime.

concepts.label: worldvolume action
concepts.description: Higher-dimensional action functional describing the dynamics of extended objects (branes) in target spacetime.

concepts.label: D=10 heterotic fivebrane
concepts.description: Five-dimensional extended object in ten-dimensional heterotic string theory; relates to supermembrane under compactification.

concepts.label: string-threebrane duality
concepts.description: Generalization of string-membrane duality to lower-dimensional objects; relates heterotic string to three-dimensional extended objects.

concepts.label: membrane-membrane duality
concepts.description: Duality relating different membrane theories or compactifications thereof in the context of M-theory.

concepts.label: Yukawa matrix rank
concepts.description: Number of independent couplings in the Yukawa matrix; can vary discontinuously as a function of moduli.

concepts.label: matter field wave function
concepts.description: Cohomology class χ_i representing localized matter fields in the CY compactification, contributing to Yukawa integrals.

concepts.label: heterotic standard model
concepts.description: Realistic particle physics model derived from E₈×E₈ heterotic string compactification on CY with specified line bundles.

concepts.label: Fake Monster Lie algebra
concepts.description: A generalized Kac-Moody algebra conjectured to be a broken symmetry of heterotic string theory, extending the Monster group via Borcherds construction.

concepts.label: BPS instantons
concepts.description: Euclidean field configurations preserving half the supersymmetry, contributing to non-perturbative amplitudes and protected counting functions in string theory.

concepts.label: Fourier coefficients
concepts.description: Numerical invariants appearing in the series expansion of automorphic forms, encoding graded dimensions and BPS degeneracies.

concepts.label: Fock space
concepts.description: A second-quantized Hilbert space built from creation and annihilation operators, whose graded dimensions are encoded in automorphic form coefficients.

concepts.label: loop amplitude
concepts.description: A multi-loop contribution to string scattering amplitudes, whose structure is constrained by automorphic forms and BPS instantons.

concepts.label: BPS counting function
concepts.description: A generating function whose coefficients enumerate BPS states or instanton contributions, controlled by automorphic forms.

concepts.label: generalized Kac-Moody symmetry
concepts.description: An infinite-dimensional symmetry algebra extending ordinary Kac-Moody algebras, proposed to underlie the structure of supersymmetric string vacua.

concepts.label: supersymmetric string vacuum
concepts.description: A consistent ground state of superstring theory preserving some fraction of supersymmetry, characterized by moduli and protected degeneracies.

concepts.label: Monster group
concepts.description: The largest sporadic finite simple group of order ≈ 8×10⁵³, whose representation theory connects to vertex operator algebras and string theory.

concepts.label: broken symmetry
concepts.description: A fundamental symmetry of a theory that is not manifest in the ground state, detectable only through anomalies or protected sectors.

concepts.label: Kaluza–Klein modes
concepts.description: Momentum excitations in the compactified extra dimensions of a string theory.

concepts.label: winding modes
concepts.description: String excitations that wrap around compact dimensions, with winding number measuring the number of wraps.

concepts.label: soliton spectrum
concepts.description: Collection of non-perturbative solitonic excitations and bound states in a quantum field theory or string theory.

concepts.label: dual string description
concepts.description: Alternative formulation of the same physical theory using different fundamental degrees of freedom, related by a duality transformation.

concepts.label: heterotic string model
concepts.description: String theory compactification combining E₈×E₈ or SO(32) gauge symmetry with a ten-dimensional heterotic superstring, requiring a six-dimensional Calabi-Yau internal space.

concepts.label: twisted sector
concepts.description: String excitations localized at orbifold singularities or fixed points under discrete symmetries; twisted Yukawa couplings arise from these geometrically enhanced points.

concepts.label: coupling magnitude
concepts.description: The numerical value or strength of a Yukawa interaction term, controlling the relative masses of matter fields and their mixing angles.

concepts.label: A4 flavor symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete tetrahedral flavor symmetry group acting on lepton generations to constrain mass matrices and mixing angles.

concepts.label: VEV alignment
concepts.description: Mechanism ensuring flavon scalar fields acquire vacuum expectation values in specific directions to preserve desired residual symmetries.

concepts.label: radiative neutrino mass
concepts.description: Neutrino mass generated at loop level rather than tree-level, naturally suppressing mass scale.

concepts.label: lepton flavor violation
concepts.description: Processes changing lepton flavor number, such as μ→eγ; suppressed by residual symmetries in extended models.

concepts.label: flavon potential
concepts.description: Scalar potential governing flavon fields whose VEVs determine flavor symmetry breaking pattern.

concepts.label: electroweak scale breaking
concepts.description: Flavor symmetry breaking occurring at the electroweak scale (~100 GeV) rather than at high unification scales.

concepts.label: lepton mixing matrix
concepts.description: Unitary matrix relating flavor and mass eigenstates in the leptonic sector; contains CP violation phases and mixing angles.

concepts.label: dark matter candidate
concepts.description: Stable particle neutral under Standard Model gauge symmetries, arising naturally in the extended model.

concepts.label: renormalizable model
concepts.description: Quantum field theory with only renormalizable interactions (dimension ≤ 4), without high-scale effective operators.

concepts.label: residual symmetry
concepts.description: Subgroup of original flavor symmetry preserved by the vacuum after spontaneous breaking.

concepts.label: diphoton resonance
concepts.description: Excess events in the diphoton decay channel at 125 GeV mass, potentially enhanced through flavor physics contributions.

concepts.label: quark sector extension
concepts.description: Generalization of lepton-sector A4 model to include flavor-symmetric quark mass matrices and mixing.

concepts.label: ΔL=2 processes
concepts.description: Lepton number violating interactions where the total lepton number changes by two units.

concepts.label: Muon flavor violation
concepts.description: Lepton flavor violation processes specifically involving muons as the primary particles.

concepts.label: Muonia oscillation
concepts.description: Quantum oscillation phenomenon in muonium (electron-muon bound state) induced by flavor-violating interactions.

concepts.label: Muonium-antimuonium oscillation
concepts.description: Mixing between muonium and its charge-conjugate antimuonium state, a signature of ΔL=2 processes.

concepts.label: Branching ratio
concepts.description: The probability of a particular decay or process occurring relative to all possible outcomes; LFV processes have suppressed values in the SM.

concepts.label: gauge enhancement
concepts.description: A mechanism by which a low-energy discrete symmetry emerges from a higher-dimensional or fundamental gauge theory through compactification or orbifold projection.

concepts.label: heterotic orbifold model
concepts.description: A compactification of the heterotic string on an orbifold geometry, producing a four-dimensional effective field theory with reduced gauge symmetry and discrete residual symmetries.

concepts.label: S₃ flavor symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete permutation symmetry group of order 6 acting on lepton generations to constrain mass matrices and mixing patterns.

concepts.label: neutrino masses
concepts.description: Mass eigenvalues of neutrino states generated through Yukawa couplings and seesaw mechanisms in extensions of the Standard Model.

concepts.label: charged lepton masses
concepts.description: Mass eigenvalues of electron, muon, and tau leptons determined by Yukawa couplings to Higgs fields.

concepts.label: triplet Higgs
concepts.description: Scalar fields with weak isospin-1 quantum numbers used to generate neutrino masses via type-II seesaw mechanism.

concepts.label: vacuum expectation value
concepts.description: Non-zero ground state value of a scalar field field that spontaneously breaks symmetries and generates masses.

concepts.label: maximal atmospheric mixing
concepts.description: Special case where θ₂₃ PMNS mixing angle equals π/4, implying maximal mixing between second and third generations.

concepts.label: zero reactor angle
concepts.description: Condition where θ₁₃ PMNS mixing angle vanishes, indicating absence of first-to-third generation mixing.

concepts.label: Jarlskog invariant
concepts.description: Rephase-invariant measure of CP violation in the PMNS matrix quantifying matter-antimatter asymmetry.

concepts.label: scalar potential
concepts.description: Quartic and cubic interactions of Higgs fields determining the vacuum structure and symmetry breaking pattern.

concepts.label: seesaw mechanism
concepts.description: Neutrino mass generation via heavy right-handed neutrinos or triplet Higgs, producing naturally small neutrino masses.

concepts.label: orbifold geometry
concepts.description: The quotient space construction of a manifold by a discrete group action, whose symmetries and singularities generate string-derived discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: space group selection rule
concepts.description: String theory constraint arising from the space-group structure of the orbifold that restricts which couplings are non-vanishing in the low-energy effective action.

concepts.label: discrete isometry group
concepts.description: A non-Abelian discrete subgroup of continuous isometries of the scalar manifold that survives compactification as a gauge symmetry.

concepts.label: torsion homology
concepts.description: Non-trivial torsion classes in cohomology of the compactification manifold that generate discrete gauge symmetries via the Hanany-Witten effect.

concepts.label: Hanany-Witten effect
concepts.description: A mechanism by which D-branes intersecting a fivebrane background generate non-Abelian discrete gauge symmetries from torsion.

concepts.label: magnetized brane
concepts.description: A D-brane carrying a magnetic flux along its worldvolume directions in toroidal or orbifold compactifications, generating Yukawa couplings and flavor structure.

concepts.label: twisted torus
