concepts.description: A toroidal compactification with non-Abelian discrete identifications, realizing non-Abelian isometry groups as exact symmetries.

concepts.label: extended leptonic sector
concepts.description: Non-minimal supersymmetric models containing additional lepton superfields beyond those in the MSSM.

concepts.label: high-scale seesaw
concepts.description: Realization of the seesaw mechanism where heavy physics operates far above the electroweak scale.

concepts.label: low-energy supersymmetry
concepts.description: Supersymmetric models where superpartners and new interactions are present near the electroweak scale.

concepts.label: supersymmetric scale
concepts.description: The characteristic mass scale at which supersymmetric particles and couplings are defined in the effective theory.

concepts.label: lepton flavor violating phenomenology
concepts.description: Observable consequences and experimental signatures of lepton flavor violation in particle collisions and rare decays.

concepts.label: non-minimal interactions
concepts.description: Additional couplings and interactions beyond those in the MSSM, arising from extended superfield content.

concepts.label: SU(5) GUT
concepts.description: Grand unified theory based on SU(5) gauge group unifying quarks and leptons at high energies.

concepts.label: tribimaximal lepton mixing
concepts.description: Specific lepton mixing pattern with θ₁₃≈0 and sin²θ₂₃≈1/2, arising from discrete flavor symmetries.

concepts.label: quark-lepton complementarity
concepts.description: Relation between quark and lepton mixing angles arising from unified flavor structures; θ_CKM + θ_lepton ≈ π/4.

concepts.label: infrared brane
concepts.description: Four-dimensional brane at the weak scale tip of a warped extra dimension where symmetry breaking occurs.

concepts.label: cyclic group
concepts.description: Finite or infinite group generated by a single element; fundamental building block of discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: T(7) symmetry
concepts.description: Non-Abelian finite group of order 21 used to generate lepton flavor structure in beyond-standard-model physics.

concepts.label: B-L gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Gauged Abelian symmetry based on baryon minus lepton number, extended beyond the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Z(3) residual symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete subgroup of T(7) that survives in the charged-lepton Yukawa sector after symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Charged-lepton Yukawa sector
concepts.description: Lagrangian terms controlling charged-lepton mass generation and flavor mixing through Yukawa couplings.

concepts.label: Z' gauge boson
concepts.description: Heavy vector boson associated with extended B-L gauge symmetry; mediates new interactions at LHC energies.

concepts.label: Scalar boson pair
concepts.description: Two scalar particles produced in Z' decay, mediating exotic lepton-flavor-violating or flavor-conserving final states.

concepts.label: Tau-tau-mu-e final state
concepts.description: Distinctive four-lepton decay signature with two tau leptons, one muon, and one electron, observable at the LHC.

concepts.label: LHC observability
concepts.description: Feasibility of experimentally detecting a model's predictions through collider signatures at the Large Hadron Collider.

concepts.label: lepton universality violation
concepts.description: Breaking of the Standard Model principle that all three lepton families couple identically to gauge bosons; manifests as differential decay rates among electron, muon, and tau channels.

concepts.label: four-fermion operators
concepts.description: Effective field theory operators involving four fermion fields; mediate flavor-changing interactions at energy scales below the new physics threshold.

concepts.label: B-physics anomalies
concepts.description: Observed deviations from Standard Model predictions in rare decays of B mesons, particularly in b→sℓℓ transitions and RK(*)ratios.

concepts.label: kaon rare decays
concepts.description: Suppressed kaon decays such as K→πℓℓ and KL→ℓℓ that probe flavor-changing neutral currents and are sensitive to new physics.

concepts.label: minimal flavor violation
concepts.description: Framework in which new physics couples to the Standard Model flavor structure only through the Yukawa matrices, constraining flavor-changing interactions.

concepts.label: NA62 experiment
concepts.description: High-intensity kaon experiment at CERN designed to measure rare kaon decays with precision sensitivity to beyond-Standard-Model couplings.

concepts.label: Higgs boson decays
concepts.description: Processes by which the Higgs particle decays into Standard Model fermions and bosons; flavor anomalies observed in certain decay channels.

concepts.label: 10D SYM theory
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory used as the fundamental framework for constructing four-dimensional particle physics models through compactification.

concepts.label: magnetized tori
concepts.description: Extra-dimensional compact spaces (tori) with background magnetic fluxes that generate chirality and flavor structure in the low-energy spectrum.

concepts.label: non-factorizable fluxes
concepts.description: Background gauge and geometric fluxes on the compactification manifold that do not decompose as products of individual toroidal fluxes, enriching flavor structure.

concepts.label: Scalar particle
concepts.description: New fundamental scalar bosons required to support non-Abelian discrete flavor symmetries in beyond-Standard-Model physics.

concepts.label: neutrino mass
concepts.description: The mass eigenvalues of neutrino flavour eigenstates, exhibiting a mild hierarchy relative to charged leptons.

concepts.label: atmospheric mixing angle
concepts.description: The lepton mixing parameter θ₂₃ governing ν_μ–ν_τ oscillations; predicted to deviate significantly from maximality.

concepts.label: CP violation phase
concepts.description: The Dirac CP-violating phase δ_CP in the PMNS matrix; predicted by the model to be nearly compatible with global fits.

concepts.label: neutrinoless double beta decay
concepts.description: Lepton-number-violating process that probes the absolute neutrino mass scale and Majorana nature through the effective mass |⟨m_ee⟩|.

concepts.label: normal mass hierarchy
concepts.description: The neutrino mass ordering m₁ < m₂ ≪ m₃, permitted by the model within experimental constraints; contrasts with inverted hierarchy.

concepts.label: rare K decays
concepts.description: Flavor-changing neutral-current processes in kaon sector sensitive to beyond-Standard-Model physics.

concepts.label: K→πνν̄ decay
concepts.description: Rare kaon decay mode producing pion and neutrino pair; sensitive probe of CKM unitarity and new physics.

concepts.label: μ→eγ decay
concepts.description: Muon decay to electron plus photon; lepton-flavor-violating process with stringent experimental limits.

concepts.label: lepton-flavor universality
concepts.description: Principle that SM treats different lepton flavors identically; violations tested via Kl2 and Pl2 decays.

concepts.label: Kl2 decay
concepts.description: Kaon leptonic decay mode K→l2 used to test lepton-flavor universality.

concepts.label: Pl2 decay
concepts.description: Pion leptonic decay mode P→l2 used to test lepton-flavor universality alongside Kl2.

concepts.label: quark sector
concepts.description: Flavor physics domain involving up, charm, and top quarks and their mixing and decay processes.

concepts.label: lepton sector
concepts.description: Flavor physics domain involving electrons, muons, taus and their mixing and decay processes.

concepts.label: CKM unitarity
concepts.description: Unitarity constraint on the Cabibbo-Kobayashi-Maskawa quark-mixing matrix, tested by rare K decays.

concepts.label: discrete modular symmetry
concepts.description: A discrete symmetry group acting on the modular parameter τ of the toroidal compactification, generating flavor structure through modular forms.

concepts.label: Kähler intersection form
concepts.description: Triple intersection numbers κ_{abc} computed as integrals of Kähler form wedge products; determine physical couplings and constraints in the effective theory.

concepts.label: quaternion group
concepts.description: The discrete group Q_8 or D_2' with 8 elements; the unique non-abelian discrete group arising from SU(2) or SU(3) breaking by small representations.

concepts.label: small representations
concepts.description: Low-dimensional representations (2D or 3D) of the flavor group that couple at leading order to Standard Model fermions.

concepts.label: Standard Model fermions
concepts.description: Quarks and leptons transforming under electroweak and strong interactions; carriers of flavor quantum numbers.

concepts.label: SU(2) flavor symmetry
concepts.description: A continuous 3-dimensional flavor symmetry group; when broken by a 2D representation can yield non-abelian discrete residuals.

concepts.label: Yukawa coupling texture
concepts.description: The pattern of couplings between fermions and Higgs fields, constrained by discrete symmetries to realize realistic mass hierarchies.

concepts.label: representation space
concepts.description: The vector space on which a group acts; characterised by dimension and the group's action rules.

concepts.label: gauge mediation
concepts.description: Supersymmetry breaking mechanism in which SUSY is broken in a hidden sector and transmitted to the visible sector via gauge interactions of messenger fields.

concepts.label: discrete non-Abelian symmetry
concepts.description: Finite discrete symmetry group with non-commutative multiplication structure, such as S3 or D6, acting on matter multiplets to constrain flavor mixing.

concepts.label: S3 symmetry
concepts.description: The permutation group of three objects; a non-Abelian discrete group of order 6 used to structure quark and lepton flavor.

concepts.label: messenger fields
concepts.description: Vectorlike matter multiplets coupled to the supersymmetry-breaking hidden sector that mediate SUSY breaking to the visible sector via gauge loops.

concepts.label: soft supersymmetry breaking
concepts.description: Effective low-energy Lagrangian terms that break SUSY without introducing quadratic divergences; includes gaugino and scalar masses.

concepts.label: flavor structure
concepts.description: Pattern of couplings and mass hierarchies among different generations of quarks and leptons; determined by Yukawa matrix structure.

concepts.label: quark mass hierarchy
concepts.description: Empirical observation that up-, charm-, top masses and down-, strange-, bottom masses span multiple orders of magnitude.

concepts.label: charged lepton mass
concepts.description: Mass eigenvalue of the electron, muon, or tau; exhibits a hierarchy of approximately 0.5 MeV : 106 MeV : 1776 MeV.

concepts.label: electroweak symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Spontaneous breaking of SU(2)_L × U(1)_Y gauge symmetry via Higgs mechanism, giving mass to W and Z bosons.

concepts.label: superpartner mass
concepts.description: Mass of the supersymmetric partner particle to a Standard Model fermion or boson; determined by soft SUSY breaking parameters.

concepts.label: Higgs doublet
concepts.description: SU(2)_L doublet scalar multiplet in the minimal supersymmetric standard model whose vacuum expectation value breaks electroweak symmetry.

concepts.label: vectorlike pair
concepts.description: Pair of matter multiplets forming a vector representation under the gauge group: left-handed and right-handed representations with the same gauge quantum numbers.

concepts.label: Green-Schwarz anomaly cancellation
concepts.description: Mechanism for cancelling quantum anomalies in gauge theories through counter-terms involving auxiliary fields, applicable to discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: perfect group
concepts.description: A group equal to its own commutator subgroup [G,G]=G, which automatically satisfies all anomaly constraints in field theory.

concepts.label: N=1 supersymmetry
concepts.description: Minimal supersymmetric extension with a single supercharge, where superspace coordinates transform under discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: μ problem
concepts.description: MSSM fine-tuning issue: the superpotential μ-term is unsuppressed by weak-scale physics, requiring stabilization by discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: proton decay
concepts.description: Baryon-number-violating process p → e⁺π⁰ that must be sufficiently suppressed; controlled by discrete R symmetries forbidding dangerous operators.

concepts.label: superpartner representation
concepts.description: Under discrete non-Abelian symmetries, bosonic and fermionic partners transform in different irreducible representations, constraining multiplet structure.

concepts.label: anomaly constraint
concepts.description: Consistency requirement that discrete symmetries must satisfy to avoid quantum anomalies in the effective low-energy theory.

concepts.label: one-dimensional representation
concepts.description: Irreducible representation of a discrete group where group elements act as phases; the superspace coordinate typically transforms this way under discrete R symmetries.

concepts.label: neutrino oscillations
concepts.description: Quantum mechanical phenomenon where neutrinos change flavor as they propagate, implying non-zero neutrino masses.

concepts.label: neutrino mass origin
concepts.description: Mechanism responsible for generating non-zero neutrino masses, distinguishable through CLFV rates in different seesaw scenarios.

concepts.label: type-I seesaw
concepts.description: Seesaw variant with heavy right-handed neutrinos mediating neutrino mass generation.

concepts.label: type-III seesaw
concepts.description: Seesaw variant with heavy fermion triplets mediating neutrino mass generation.

concepts.label: heavy particle exchange
concepts.description: Mechanism in beyond-Standard-Model physics where virtual heavy particles mediate low-energy processes.

concepts.label: leptogenesis
concepts.description: Mechanism generating baryon asymmetry of the Universe through CP-violating decays of heavy neutrinos in the early universe.

concepts.label: baryon asymmetry
concepts.description: Imbalance between matter and antimatter abundances in the Universe, observationally a factor of ~10^-10.

concepts.label: mixing pattern
concepts.description: Specific texture or structure of the neutrino mixing matrix imposed by flavor symmetries (e.g., tribimaximal, bimaximal).

concepts.label: heavy neutrino decay
concepts.description: Decay process of massive Majorana neutrinos producing leptons and Higgs bosons; source of CP violation in leptogenesis.

concepts.label: Democracy matrix
concepts.description: Matrix D with all entries equal, appearing as the symmetric term dominating charged lepton and quark mass matrices under S₃.

concepts.label: Identity matrix term
concepts.description: Universal I term in mass matrices, dominating neutrino masses and modifying mixing angles upon perturbative breaking of S₃.

concepts.label: Neutrino mass degeneracy
concepts.description: Near-equal masses of three light neutrinos arising naturally from domination of the universal I term in the neutrino mass matrix.

concepts.label: Charged lepton mass matrix
concepts.description: Mass matrix M_l for charged leptons (electron, muon, tau) with hierarchical spectrum dominated by the D term under S₃.

concepts.label: Down-type quark mass matrix
concepts.description: Mass matrix M_d for down, strange, and bottom quarks with hierarchical spectrum dominated by the D term.

concepts.label: Generalized Froggatt-Nielsen mechanism
concepts.description: An extension of the Froggatt-Nielsen mechanism incorporating non-singlet Higgs fields and GUT group structure to unify gauge symmetry breaking with hierarchical flavor generation.

concepts.label: non-renormalizable operators
concepts.description: Operators with mass dimension greater than four in four-dimensional effective field theory, suppressed by inverse powers of a cutoff scale.

concepts.label: non-singlet Higgs field
concepts.description: A Higgs field transforming non-trivially under the GUT gauge group, carrying quantum numbers beyond the singlet representation.

concepts.label: universality conditions
concepts.description: Constraints imposed on coupling coefficients that relate different contractions in group theoretical products within the generalized mechanism.

concepts.label: SO(10) GUT
concepts.description: Grand Unified Theory based on the SO(10) gauge group, a larger unification framework that includes matter-parity conservation.

concepts.label: lepton-quark mixing
concepts.description: The mixing between quark and lepton sectors arising from different mass eigenbasis and weak eigenbasis bases.

concepts.label: flavon field
concepts.description: A scalar field whose vacuum expectation value breaks flavor symmetry and generates the hierarchical structure of fermion masses.

concepts.label: Z₄^R symmetry
concepts.description: A discrete R-symmetry of order 4 that constrains the superpotential and Kähler potential, forbidding the μ-term and constraining allowed Yukawa couplings.

concepts.label: μ-term
concepts.description: The supersymmetric Higgs mass parameter in the superpotential; forbidden by Z₄^R symmetry and generated dynamically at the supersymmetry breaking scale.

concepts.label: right-handed neutrino
concepts.description: A singlet fermion superfield under the standard model gauge group that carries lepton number and participates in the seesaw mechanism to generate small neutrino masses.

concepts.label: charge assignment
concepts.description: The assignment of U(1)_R charges to standard model field superfields (quarks, leptons, Higgses, right-handed neutrinos), constrained by anomaly cancellation and family symmetry.

concepts.label: VEV suppression
concepts.description: Exponential suppression of Yukawa couplings arising from powers of the ratio of a scalar VEV to the Planck scale in the Froggatt-Nielsen mechanism.

concepts.label: 331-model
concepts.description: Extension of the Standard Model with SU(3)_C ⊗ SU(3)_L ⊗ U(1)_X gauge symmetry that explains the number of fermion families.

concepts.label: linear seesaw
concepts.description: Mechanism for generating light neutrino masses through a linear combination of Type-I and Type-III seesaw contributions.

concepts.label: mass squared differences
concepts.description: Observables Δm²_ij measuring the squared mass splittings between neutrino mass eigenstates, measured in oscillation experiments.

concepts.label: new physics scale
concepts.description: Energy scale at which new heavy particles or interactions become relevant, typically constrained by precision tests and collider searches.

concepts.label: Majorana mass matrix
concepts.description: The mass matrix for right-handed neutrinos in the seesaw mechanism; hierarchical structure directly impacts the light neutrino mass matrix.

concepts.label: hierarchical factor
concepts.description: A small dimensionless suppression parameter (or power thereof) appearing in effective Yukawa couplings to generate mass hierarchy; typically proportional to small VEV ratios or coupling constants.

concepts.label: mass diagonal basis
concepts.description: The basis in which the fermion mass matrices are diagonal, containing mass eigenstate vectors; the natural basis for computing physical observables.

concepts.label: large mixing
concepts.description: Significant non-trivial mixing angles in the flavor-mixing matrix, departing from the hierarchical or small-angle pattern observed in the quark sector.

concepts.label: neutrino mass model
concepts.description: A theoretical framework explaining the origin of neutrino masses and their mixing parameters beyond the Standard Model.

concepts.label: modular weights
concepts.description: Quantum numbers assigned to fields under modular symmetry transformations; replace traditional FN charges in the modular symmetry framework.

concepts.label: neutrino oscillation parameters
concepts.description: Experimental observables characterising neutrino flavor mixing, including mixing angles θ₁₂, θ₂₃, θ₁₃ and mass-squared differences.

concepts.label: Peccei-Quinn symmetry
concepts.description: A global U(1) symmetry whose spontaneous breaking produces the axion as a pseudo-Goldstone boson, solving the strong CP problem.

concepts.label: flavored axion
concepts.description: An axion carrying family or flavor quantum numbers, mediating couplings between different fermion generations.

concepts.label: axion-photon coupling
concepts.description: The effective interaction between the axion and electromagnetic field, characterized by the coupling constant g_{aγγ}.

concepts.label: axion flavor violation
concepts.description: Processes mediated by flavored axions that violate family quantum numbers, leading to flavor-changing couplings between fermion generations.

concepts.label: Nearest-Neighbour-Interaction
concepts.description: A texture in mass matrices where only adjacent generations couple, suppressing cross-generational interactions.

concepts.label: neutrino mass texture
concepts.description: A specific pattern of zeros and hierarchical values in the neutrino mass matrix arising from symmetry constraints.

concepts.label: strong CP problem
concepts.description: The question of why the QCD θ-parameter is experimentally constrained to be extremely small, despite being technically natural in the Standard Model.

concepts.label: UV completion
concepts.description: An extension of an effective low-energy theory that is valid at higher energy scales and reduces to the effective theory at low energies.

concepts.label: chiral heavy fields
concepts.description: Vector-like fermions that transform chirally (not vectorially) under the Froggatt-Nielsen family symmetry, modifying the anomaly structure of the Standard Model.

concepts.label: mixed anomalies
concepts.description: Gauge anomalies arising from the interplay between the Froggatt-Nielsen symmetry and Standard Model gauge currents (SU(3)×SU(2)×U(1)).

concepts.label: gauged Froggatt-Nielsen symmetry
concepts.description: Promotion of the Froggatt-Nielsen family symmetry to a local gauge symmetry, enabled when chiral heavy fields cancel anomalies without spectator fermions.

concepts.label: spectator fermions
concepts.description: Additional vector-like fermions introduced in traditional FN models to cancel anomalies when gauging the family symmetry.

concepts.label: flavourful axion
concepts.description: An axion emerging from the Peccei-Quinn symmetry in FN models, which couples preferentially to matter fields (especially fermions) rather than gluons.

concepts.label: Standard Model gauge group
concepts.description: The local gauge symmetry SU(3)_C ⊗ SU(2)_L ⊗ U(1)_Y underlying electroweak and strong interactions.

concepts.label: anomalous flavor symmetry
concepts.description: A family symmetry that is violated at the quantum level by triangle anomalies, typically requiring spectator fermions to restore gauge invariance if gauged.

concepts.label: matter coupling
concepts.description: The strength and structure of interactions between a scalar field (axion) and Standard Model fermions, proportional to their masses in many models.

concepts.label: neutrino Yukawa couplings
concepts.description: Coupling constants Y_{ijk} appearing in the lepton-neutrino interaction Lagrangian, controlled by the Froggatt-Nielsen mechanism.

concepts.label: heavy Majorana neutrino mass
concepts.description: Mass term for right-handed singlet neutrinos in the seesaw mechanism, typically at high energy scales.

concepts.label: large neutrino mixing
concepts.description: Deviation of the lepton mixing matrix from the quark CKM hierarchy, characterized by large mixing angles θ₁₂, θ₂₃, and θ₁₃.

concepts.label: Majorana CP phase
concepts.description: Complex phases appearing in the neutrino mass matrix that affect lepton-number-violating processes but not neutrino oscillations.

concepts.label: mu to e+gamma decay
concepts.description: A lepton-flavor-violating process in which a muon decays to a positron and photon; suppressed in the Standard Model but enhanced in beyond-SM theories.

concepts.label: scotogenic mechanism
concepts.description: Radiative mechanism for neutrino mass generation where loop-level contributions to mass arise from interactions with dark sector fields.

concepts.label: soft symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Explicit breaking of a global or gauge symmetry via mass terms and couplings with small dimensionless parameters, preserving renormalizability.

concepts.label: dark sector
concepts.description: Collection of particles and interactions decoupled from Standard Model gauge interactions; includes dark matter and mediators.

concepts.label: charged lepton
concepts.description: Massive lepton species (electron, muon, tau) carrying electric charge; possess hierarchical masses.

concepts.label: SMEFT
concepts.description: Standard Model Effective Field Theory: model-independent framework parameterising potential BSM physics through higher-dimensional operators built from SM fields and respecting electroweak symmetry.

concepts.label: fermion flavour puzzle
concepts.description: Unsolved problem in particle physics of explaining the origin and pattern of fermion mass hierarchies and mixing angles measured in the Standard Model.

concepts.label: matching condition
concepts.description: Relation between UV effective vertices in a BSM model and IR effective operators in SMEFT, obtained by integrating out heavy BSM degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: tree-level diagram
concepts.description: Feynman diagram with no loops contributing to matching coefficients at leading order in perturbation theory.

concepts.label: one-loop diagram
concepts.description: Feynman diagram with one closed loop contributing to matching coefficients at next-to-leading order in the coupling expansion.

concepts.label: contact term
concepts.description: UV effective interaction in the Froggatt-Nielsen Lagrangian arising from integrating out very heavy BSM particles at the deep-UV scale.

concepts.label: discrete family symmetry
concepts.description: Non-Abelian or Abelian discrete group (such as D₆, S₃, or A₄) acting on fermion generations to explain mass hierarchies and predict mixing patterns.

concepts.label: moduli stabilisation
concepts.description: Mechanism fixing the values of complex-structure and Kähler moduli in string compactifications via non-perturbative effects or flux.

concepts.label: infrared operator
concepts.description: Higher-dimensional effective operator in the SMEFT valid below the electroweak scale, parameterising low-energy consequences of BSM physics.

concepts.label: E8 gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Largest simple Lie group appearing at points of gauge enhancement in F-theory; contains SU(5) and provides rich matter structure.

concepts.label: matter curves
concepts.description: Divisors in the F-theory base surface supporting chiral matter; intersections of curves determine coupling structure.

concepts.label: GUT singlets
concepts.description: Scalar fields that are singlets under the SU(5) gauge group; acquiring vevs can break GUT symmetry and implement Froggatt-Nielsen suppression.

concepts.label: doublet-triplet splitting
concepts.description: Problem in GUT models where the Higgs doublet and colour-triplet partners have naturally similar masses, requiring unnatural fine-tuning.

concepts.label: R-parity
concepts.description: Discrete symmetry Z₂ multiplicatively defined on fields, forbidding rapid proton decay in supersymmetric extensions of the standard model.

concepts.label: phenomenological constraints
concepts.description: Experimental data and theoretical bounds used to filter model predictions; includes precision measurements of masses, mixings, and decay rates.

concepts.label: Two Higgs Doublet Model
concepts.description: An extension of the Standard Model with two scalar doublets coupling to fermions, introducing additional Higgs bosons and flavor-changing neutral currents.

concepts.label: Natural Flavor Conservation
concepts.description: A symmetry property of the Yukawa sector preventing flavor-changing neutral currents at tree level; can be of Type II or Type IV depending on Higgs doublet assignments.

concepts.label: Higgs phenomenology
concepts.description: The study of Higgs boson production, decay, and interactions at colliders and other experiments.

concepts.label: Approximate symmetry
concepts.description: A symmetry that is not exact at the fundamental level but emerges as an approximate feature of the low-energy effective theory.

concepts.label: Cosmic strings
concepts.description: One-dimensional topological defects formed during phase transitions in the early Universe, produced when a continuous symmetry is spontaneously broken.

concepts.label: Stochastic gravitational wave background
concepts.description: A random superposition of gravitational waves from unresolved sources or cosmological processes, detectable as a spectrum rather than individual signals.

concepts.label: String tension
concepts.description: The energy per unit length of a cosmic string, determining the amplitude and frequency spectrum of gravitational waves it radiates.

concepts.label: Flavour observables
concepts.description: Low-energy precision measurements of processes involving flavour-changing interactions, rare decays, and mixing phenomena sensitive to high-scale physics.

concepts.label: Gravitational wave experiments
concepts.description: Future observatories designed to detect gravitational wave signals across various frequency bands, including LISA, Einstein Telescope, and Cosmic Explorer.

concepts.label: Parameter space closure
concepts.description: The elimination of viable regions in the space of theory parameters through combined experimental and observational constraints.

concepts.label: string theory landscape
concepts.description: The ensemble of string theory vacua generated by scanning over discrete flux parameter values, providing a statistical framework for predicting physical quantities.

concepts.label: spurion
concepts.description: A fictitious scalar field with prescribed transformation properties under global symmetries, used to parameterize symmetry-breaking effects in effective field theory.

concepts.label: wrinkles
concepts.description: Corrections or deviations to naïve Froggatt-Nielsen scaling of new physics couplings arising from additional UV dynamics or symmetries.

concepts.label: leptoquark
concepts.description: A hypothetical colored scalar or vector boson coupling simultaneously to leptons and quarks, mediating proton decay or flavor-changing processes.

concepts.label: flavor spurion
concepts.description: A spurion field transforming non-trivially under horizontal flavor symmetries, encoding flavor structure in the effective Lagrangian.

concepts.label: power counting
concepts.description: A systematic expansion scheme parameterizing operator contributions by inverse powers of a symmetry-breaking scale or spurion VEV.

concepts.label: flavor observable
concepts.description: A measured quantity (mass, branching ratio, mixing angle) sensitive to flavor physics and Yukawa structure.

concepts.label: monotonicity condition
concepts.description: A standard constraint in Froggatt-Nielsen models requiring spurion charges to increase monotonically across generations.

concepts.label: new physics coupling
concepts.description: An interaction involving new particles or operators beyond the Standard Model, whose strength is constrained by flavor symmetries.

concepts.label: U(1)_X symmetry
concepts.description: Abelian horizontal symmetry that acts on matter generations and constrains Yukawa couplings in flavour models.

concepts.label: GUT scale constraint
concepts.description: Bounds on coupling constants and particle properties derived from grand unification or running from high to weak scales.

concepts.label: weak scale constraint
concepts.description: Experimental or theoretical limits on coupling constants and decay rates measured or extrapolated to electroweak energy scales.

concepts.label: multimodal understanding
concepts.description: Capability to comprehend and process information from multiple modalities including text and images simultaneously.

concepts.label: text-to-image generation
concepts.description: Task of synthesizing images from natural language text descriptions using deep learning models.

concepts.label: image editing
concepts.description: Process of modifying or manipulating existing images through semantic instructions or direct interventions.

concepts.label: diffusion-based visual decoder
concepts.description: Neural architecture component using diffusion models to decode latent representations into coherent visual outputs.

concepts.label: bidirectional token refiner
concepts.description: Neural module that refines token representations by processing information in both forward and backward directions.

concepts.label: unified training
concepts.description: Joint end-to-end training approach that simultaneously optimizes a model for multiple tasks using shared parameters and objectives.

concepts.label: language model foundation
concepts.description: Base pre-trained transformer model initialized from language understanding weights that serves as backbone for multimodal extension.

concepts.label: MLLM
concepts.description: Multimodal Large Language Model; frozen or unfrozen neural architecture combining language understanding with visual perception.

concepts.label: Ovis series
concepts.description: Family of unified multimodal models designed for integrated understanding, generation, and editing tasks.

concepts.label: OpenCompass Multi-modal Academic Benchmark
concepts.description: Standardized evaluation suite measuring multimodal understanding performance across diverse academic tasks.

concepts.label: DPG-Bench
concepts.description: Benchmark for evaluating text-to-image generation quality and fidelity.

concepts.label: GenEval
concepts.description: Evaluation metric for assessing semantic alignment and visual quality in generated images.

concepts.label: ImgEdit-Bench
concepts.description: Benchmark measuring image editing task performance and semantic preservation.

concepts.label: GEdit-Bench-EN
concepts.description: English-language benchmark for evaluating image editing capabilities and instruction-following accuracy.

concepts.label: Mixing angle
concepts.description: One of three real parameters (θ₁₂, θ₂₃, θ₁₃) parameterising the magnitude of quark flavor mixing in the CKM matrix.

concepts.label: axion-like particle
concepts.description: A light pseudoscalar boson with axion-like couplings to Standard Model fermions and gauge bosons, arising from spontaneous breaking of approximate global symmetries.

concepts.label: FN scale
concepts.description: The characteristic mass scale at which the spurion fields acquire vacuum expectation values in the Froggatt-Nielsen mechanism.

concepts.label: quark-lepton mass ratio
concepts.description: The relative magnitude of quark and lepton masses, reflecting different structure of the up, down, and charged-lepton sectors.

concepts.label: field content minimization
concepts.description: The principle of constructing effective theories with the fewest auxiliary fields necessary to achieve the required symmetry structure and textures.

concepts.label: phenomenological constraint
concepts.description: An experimental or observational bound derived from measurements of masses, mixing angles, decay rates, or other low-energy observables.

concepts.label: higher-dimensional operator
concepts.description: An interaction with canonical dimension greater than four, suppressed by powers of the UV completion scale in an effective field theory.

concepts.label: tensor mode fraction
concepts.description: The ratio of tensor (gravitational wave) perturbations to scalar perturbations in inflationary dynamics, characterized by r = 16ε in slow-roll inflation.

concepts.label: eternal inflation
concepts.description: A self-reproducing inflationary regime in which quantum fluctuations continuously spawn new inflationary domains, rendering the universe spatially infinite.

concepts.label: quantum tunneling
concepts.description: Probabilistic quantum transition between vacua mediated by bubble nucleation; governs vacuum decay and transitions across the landscape.

concepts.label: large-field inflation
concepts.description: Inflationary mechanism in which the scalar field traverses a super-Planckian distance (Δφ > m_p), typically producing large tensor modes (r > 0.01).

concepts.label: warped geometry
concepts.description: A ten-dimensional compactification metric with a warp factor f(y) controlling the effective 4D Planck scale and coupling strengths.

concepts.label: inflationary mechanism
concepts.description: A dynamical system driven by a scalar field potential that achieves exponential expansion and dilutes primordial perturbations.

concepts.label: vacuum measure
concepts.description: A probability distribution over string theory vacua used to define expectations and relative frequencies; varies with measure choice (causal, volume-weighted, etc.).

concepts.label: D-brane
concepts.description: Extended object in string theory on which open string endpoints are confined; carries RR charges and generates non-Abelian gauge groups.

concepts.label: tree-level mediation
concepts.description: Direct coupling of SUSY-breaking sector to matter fields at tree level in addition to loop-suppressed mediation.

concepts.label: effective supersymmetric model
concepts.description: Low-energy effective field theory retaining SUSY structure after integrating out high-scale messenger states.

concepts.label: loop-suppressed coupling
concepts.description: Interaction strength reduced by loop factors in gauge mediation, establishing the mediation scale.

concepts.label: massive photon
concepts.description: Photon with non-zero rest mass, arising when gauge invariance is broken; violates Lorentz invariance if treated naively.

concepts.label: Lorentz non-invariance
concepts.description: Breaking of spacetime translation and rotation symmetry that emerges from massive photons or other exotic field theories.

concepts.label: neutrino mass hierarchy
concepts.description: The pattern of neutrino mass eigenvalues, classified as normal (m₁<m₂<m₃) or inverted (m₃<m₁<m₂), constrained by oscillation measurements.

concepts.label: quark mass matrix
concepts.description: Effective Yukawa coupling matrix in the quark sector determining up and down quark masses and CKM mixing after electroweak symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: lepton mass matrix
concepts.description: Effective Yukawa coupling matrix in the lepton sector determining charged lepton and neutrino masses and PMNS mixing angles.

concepts.label: effective mass parameter
concepts.description: The combination of Majorana masses and PMNS matrix elements that appears in the neutrinoless double beta decay amplitude, m_ee = Σᵢ U²_ei m_νᵢ.

concepts.label: parameter space
concepts.description: The multi-dimensional space of model parameters (masses, couplings, angles) that are consistent with experimental constraints and theoretical consistency.

concepts.label: mass hierarchy problem
concepts.description: The theoretical puzzle of explaining the exponential hierarchy between the electroweak scale and neutrino/quark mass scales using underlying symmetries.

concepts.label: quark mixing angles
concepts.description: Parameters of the CKM matrix describing the strength of flavour-changing weak interactions in the quark sector.

concepts.label: unitary transformation
concepts.description: A basis change in flavour space relating the interaction eigenbasis to the mass eigenbasis of fermions.

concepts.label: Barbieri-Giudice measure
concepts.description: A quantitative criterion for naturalness that measures the fine-tuning required in a model to reproduce observed parameters.

concepts.label: texture tuning
concepts.description: The degree to which a Froggatt-Nielsen model requires fine-tuned or accidental cancellations to match experimental data.

concepts.label: symplectic reduction
concepts.description: Geometric technique reducing the dimension of a symplectic manifold by quotient under a Hamiltonian group action, preserving symplectic structure.

concepts.label: Lagrangian submanifold
concepts.description: Submanifold of dimension n in a 2n-dimensional symplectic manifold on which the symplectic form vanishes.

concepts.label: Hamiltonian deformation
concepts.description: Continuous family of symplectic embeddings generated by time-evolution under a Hamiltonian vector field, preserving the symplectic structure.

concepts.label: graded Lagrangian
concepts.description: Lagrangian submanifold equipped with a grading compatible with the holomorphic form, imposing phase constraints on the symplectic structure.

concepts.label: stability condition
concepts.description: Mathematical criterion on objects in a triangulated category (or geometric structure) determining when they satisfy existence or rigidity properties.

concepts.label: Chern-Simons functional
concepts.description: Topological functional on principal bundles and gauge connections whose critical points are flat connections, related to knot invariants and 3D topology.

concepts.label: homology class
concepts.description: Equivalence class of cycles in homology theory, invariant under boundaries and used to classify topological properties of submanifolds.

concepts.label: monodromy pairing
concepts.description: Monodromy-invariant bilinear pairing on the cohomology of a mirror pair of Calabi-Yau manifolds, encoding period relationships.

concepts.label: Gromov-Witten invariants
concepts.description: Enumerative invariants counting rational curves of genus g and degree d on a Calabi-Yau 3-fold, computed via mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: hypergeometric series
concepts.description: Special functions appearing in the period integrals and prepotential of Calabi-Yau manifolds, satisfying Picard-Fuchs ODEs.

concepts.label: local mirror symmetry
concepts.description: Mirror symmetry limit isolating the geometry near a del Pezzo surface within a Calabi-Yau 3-fold, relating local Gromov-Witten invariants to affine Hecke algebras.

concepts.label: Lagrangian section
concepts.description: A Lagrangian submanifold that intersects each fibre of a Lagrangian fibration transversely in a single point.

concepts.label: Conic bundle
concepts.description: A 3-dimensional variety that is a P¹-bundle over a 2-dimensional base, dual to a Lagrangian torus fibration on the SYZ side.

concepts.label: Wrapped Floer cohomology
concepts.description: Floer cohomology of Lagrangian submanifolds with cylindrical boundary conditions at infinity, used to study non-compact symplectic manifolds.

concepts.label: Mirror toric variety
concepts.description: The toric variety dual to a given toric variety via the toric monomial-divisor correspondence, obtained by Legendre transform of the moment polytope.

concepts.label: Wrapped Fukaya category
concepts.description: A triangulated category of Lagrangian submanifolds in a Liouville manifold, where morphisms are wrapped Floer cohomology groups.

concepts.label: Zero section
concepts.description: The distinguished Lagrangian section of a Lagrangian fibration obtained by choosing the zero point in each fibre (Lagrangian torus).

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau orbifold quotient
concepts.description: A quotient of a Calabi-Yau manifold by a finite group action, preserving the canonical bundle condition up to characters.

concepts.label: Symplectic topology
concepts.description: The study of symplectic manifolds and Lagrangian submanifolds using techniques from topology and analysis.

concepts.label: boundary state
concepts.description: Quantum state describing the geometric and topological data of a D-brane wrapped on a supersymmetric cycle in a Calabi-Yau space.

concepts.label: Ramond-Ramond field
concepts.description: Differential form in string theory coupling to D-branes; its monodromic structure around singularities constrains D-brane configurations.

concepts.label: closed string instanton
concepts.description: Worldsheet instanton correction to closed string amplitudes arising from maps of the sphere worldsheet to the Calabi-Yau target space.

concepts.label: A-model
concepts.description: Topological field theory on the worldsheet coupled to Kähler geometry of Calabi-Yau; counts holomorphic curves and instanton corrections.

concepts.label: B-model
concepts.description: Topological field theory on the worldsheet coupled to complex-structure geometry of Calabi-Yau; computable via periods and Picard-Fuchs equations.

concepts.label: D-brane period
concepts.description: Integral of differential forms over a D-brane cycle, encoding topological and geometric information transformed under mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: non-complete intersection
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau variety not defined as a simple intersection of hypersurfaces in projective space; requires more sophisticated construction techniques.

concepts.label: Pfaffian Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau threefold defined by the vanishing locus of a Pfaffian (determinant of a skew-symmetric matrix), a class of non-complete intersection varieties.

concepts.label: period integrals
concepts.description: Integrals of the holomorphic (3,0)-form over cycles in a Calabi-Yau manifold; fundamental invariants encoding mirror symmetry predictions.

concepts.label: mirror family
concepts.description: A one-parameter or multi-parameter family of Calabi-Yau manifolds obtained as the mirror of a given family, related by mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: monodromy point
concepts.description: A special value of the modulus parameter where the monodromy action on cohomology becomes maximal; particularly significant when unipotent.

concepts.label: Fourier-Mukai transform
concepts.description: Derived equivalence between coherent sheaf categories of Calabi-Yau manifolds; related to mirror pairs and birational geometry.

concepts.label: central charge formula
concepts.description: Formula relating central charges in string theory to periods of mirror CY families; validates mirror symmetry construction.

concepts.label: SYZ mirror transformation
concepts.description: A Fourier-Mukai-type geometric transformation providing explicit understanding of mirror symmetry for semi-flat Calabi-Yau manifolds and toric Fano varieties.

concepts.label: semi-flat Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau manifold admitting a special fibration structure with toric fibres, amenable to explicit mirror construction via SYZ duality.

concepts.label: geometric mirror symmetry
concepts.description: Explicit geometric realization of mirror symmetry between dual Calabi-Yau manifolds via SYZ fibrations and Fourier-Mukai transformations.

concepts.label: fibration structure
concepts.description: Decomposition of a manifold into a family of fibres parametrized by a base space; essential for SYZ mirror construction in semi-flat settings.

concepts.label: rigidity
concepts.description: Minimal dimension over which a Feynman integral is non-polylogarithmic; measures geometric complexity of the integral.

concepts.label: polylogarithmic
concepts.description: Class of special functions expressible as nested logarithmic integrals; Feynman integrals below rigidity threshold reduce to such functions.

concepts.label: marginal Feynman integral
concepts.description: Feynman integral with exactly (L+1)D/2 propagators in D dimensions; generically involves CY geometries and saturates rigidity bound.

concepts.label: loop order L
concepts.description: Number of independent loop momenta in a Feynman diagram; determines expected dimension and complexity scaling.

concepts.label: rigidity bound
concepts.description: Upper limit 2(L-1) on the rigidity of massless Feynman integrals in four dimensions.

concepts.label: dimension D
concepts.description: Spacetime dimensionality in which Feynman integrals are evaluated; determines propagator count and marginal conditions.

concepts.label: finite Feynman integral
concepts.description: Feynman integral that converges without ultraviolet or infrared renormalization; lacks divergences.

concepts.label: massless propagator
concepts.description: Virtual particle propagator with zero mass; appears in integrals where rigidity and geometric structure become prominent.

concepts.label: four-dimensional theory
concepts.description: Quantum field theory formulated in four spacetime dimensions; the physical case where Feynman integral bounds are sharpest.

concepts.label: auxiliary geometry
concepts.description: Geometric space (such as a CY manifold) that emerges from or encodes the structure of Feynman integrals via period integrals.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau orbifold
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau variety with a finite group action, preserving the Kähler-Einstein metric and holomorphic volume form up to phase.

concepts.label: Fermat hypersurface
concepts.description: A hypersurface defined by a sum of monomials with equal exponents in weighted projective space, exhibiting maximal symmetry and explicit period calculations.

concepts.label: Fermat motive
concepts.description: A motivic object associated to a Fermat hypersurface or Calabi-Yau orbifold, encoding arithmetic and topological properties via Chow groups.

concepts.label: monomial class
concepts.description: Equivalence classes of monomials in graded polynomial rings associated to Calabi-Yau orbifolds, parametrized by group actions.

concepts.label: Dwork method
concepts.description: p-adic analytic approach using Dwork characters, Gauss sums, and L-functions to count rational points on hypersurfaces.

concepts.label: Gauss sum
concepts.description: A character sum over finite fields or p-adic numbers; appears in counting rational points and in mirror symmetry via Jacobi sums.

concepts.label: Weil method
concepts.description: Algebraic number-theoretic approach using Jacobi and Gauss sums to count rational points on varieties over finite fields.

concepts.label: rational point counting
concepts.description: Computation of the number of points on an algebraic variety defined over a finite field; relates to topological invariants via mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Landau-Ginzburg point
concepts.description: A distinguished point in the moduli space of Calabi-Yau varieties (typically Fermat point) where Picard-Fuchs structure simplifies and mirror symmetry is manifest.

concepts.label: weighted projective space
concepts.description: A quotient of affine space by a diagonal torus action, generalizing projective space; natural setting for Fermat hypersurfaces.

concepts.label: relative cohomology
concepts.description: Cohomology group H^*(X, Y) measuring the topology of a space X relative to a subspace Y, used in the study of families of varieties.

concepts.label: D-module structure
concepts.description: The structure of a module over the ring of differential operators, encoding how differential equations act on spaces of integrals.

concepts.label: polynomial at infinity
concepts.description: An algebraic polynomial whose behavior at infinity is controlled, ensuring regularity of the associated hypersurface and finiteness of critical values.

concepts.label: algebraic variety
concepts.description: A geometric object defined by polynomial equations, serving as the ambient space for cohomological and integral-theoretic constructions.

concepts.label: holomorphic differential forms
concepts.description: Differential forms on complex manifolds that are holomorphic, used to define periods and Yukawa couplings on Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: isomorphism theorem
concepts.description: A fundamental result establishing a canonical equivalence between two algebraic structures, here between relative cohomology and Abelian integral modules.

concepts.label: critical values
concepts.description: Parameter values at which the algebraic variety becomes singular or acquires special geometric properties, determining the structure of the Picard-Fuchs system.

concepts.label: affine algebraic surface
concepts.description: An algebraic variety of dimension 2 defined by polynomial equations in affine space, studied via coordinate rings and geometric properties.

concepts.label: algebraic group action
concepts.description: A morphism from an algebraic group to the automorphism group of a variety, defining how group elements act on points.

concepts.label: ind-group
concepts.description: An infinite-dimensional algebraic group realised as a direct limit of finite-dimensional algebraic groups.

concepts.label: combinatorial group theory
concepts.description: The study of groups via generators, relations, and combinatorial structures such as amalgams and free products.

concepts.label: amalgam
concepts.description: A combinatorial structure representing how group generators and relations assemble; used to study infinite group presentations.

concepts.label: affine surface classification
concepts.description: The systematic organisation of affine surfaces into classes by geometric and algebraic invariants, including automorphism structure.

concepts.label: algebraic group
concepts.description: A group that is also an algebraic variety, with group operations defined by polynomial maps.

concepts.label: automorphism invariants
concepts.description: Algebraic or geometric quantities preserved under the action of the full automorphism group of a variety.

concepts.label: Picard-Fuchs equations
concepts.description: Differential equations governing the variation of periods in moduli spaces, determining how periods transform under moduli deformations.

concepts.label: Seiberg-Witten model
concepts.description: N=2 supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory with low-energy effective description controlled by a prepotential and periods.

concepts.label: spectral curve
concepts.description: Algebraic curve encoding the BPS spectrum and central charges of N=2 gauge theory, defined via the characteristic polynomial of the Lax pair.

concepts.label: gauge group
concepts.description: Lie group symmetry of the Yang-Mills theory; classical types include SU(N), SO(N), Sp(2N).

concepts.label: classical Lie group
concepts.description: Standard Lie groups of matrices (SU, SO, Sp) as opposed to exceptional groups; characterized by finite rank.

concepts.label: rank
concepts.description: Dimension of the Cartan subalgebra of a Lie group; determines the number of independent moduli parameters.

concepts.label: semi-classical regime
concepts.description: Limit where the coupling is weak and perturbative expansions are valid; in SW theory, the region near weak coupling.

concepts.label: series solution
concepts.description: Power series ansatz for solving differential equations; for PF equations, typically a Frobenius series around singular points.

concepts.label: differential equation
concepts.description: Mathematical equation relating a function and its derivatives; Picard-Fuchs equations are linear ODEs of order r.

concepts.label: regular solution
concepts.description: One of r linearly independent solutions to an order-r Picard-Fuchs system in the semi-classical expansion.

concepts.label: exceptional solution
concepts.description: Additional distinguished solution (e.g., logarithmic or non-polynomial) that appears alongside regular power-series solutions in the PF system.

concepts.label: closed form
concepts.description: Explicit analytic expression or algebraic description, as opposed to numerical or implicit characterization.

concepts.label: generalized Dwork family
concepts.description: A parametric family of hypersurfaces defined by Katz generalizing the classical Dwork family, used to study modular forms and Galois representations.

concepts.label: Frobenius matrix
concepts.description: The matrix of Frobenius action on rigid cohomology, determining p-adic L-functions and Galois representations of the family.

concepts.label: rigid cohomology
concepts.description: A p-adic cohomology theory for varieties over finite fields, dual to rigid homology and used to compute Frobenius eigenvalues.

concepts.label: Arithmetic Fuchsian group
concepts.description: A discrete subgroup of PSL(2,ℝ) derived from quaternion algebras or number fields; acts properly discontinuously on the hyperbolic upper half-plane.

concepts.label: Period space
concepts.description: The space parametrizing periods of differential forms on varieties in a family; typically a domain in projective space or Grassmannian.

concepts.label: Invariant subfamily
concepts.description: A geometric subfamily of a family of varieties fixed pointwise or setwise by a group action; inherits special symmetry properties.

concepts.label: Maximal Picard rank
concepts.description: The property that a K3 surface has Picard lattice of rank 20, the maximum possible; such surfaces are special and form lower-dimensional families.

concepts.label: Hauptmodul
concepts.description: Uniformizing function for a Riemann surface of genus zero; generates the function field of the modular curve.

concepts.label: Schwarzian derivative
concepts.description: Projective differential operator measuring deviation from linearity; satisfies differential equations for modular forms.

concepts.label: elliptic curve family
concepts.description: One-parameter or multi-parameter family of elliptic curves with varying moduli and associated period integrals.

concepts.label: Painlevé VI equation
concepts.description: Nonlinear second-order ODE with the Painlevé property; arises from isomonodromic deformation of Fuchsian systems.

concepts.label: elliptic integral
concepts.description: Integral of an algebraic function involving a quadratic form; solutions expressed in terms of elliptic functions.

concepts.label: inhomogeneous differential equation
concepts.description: ODE or PDE with a non-zero right-hand side; solutions decompose into homogeneous plus particular solution.

concepts.label: isomonodromic deformation
concepts.description: Deformation of a differential system preserving monodromy structure; often governed by Painlevé equations.

concepts.label: Fuchsian system
concepts.description: Linear ODE system with regular singular points; monodromy matrices are well-defined and generate a discrete group.

concepts.label: modular curve
concepts.description: Quotient of the upper half-plane by a congruence subgroup; genus-zero curves admit Hauptmoduls as function field generators.

concepts.label: varying endpoints
concepts.description: Integration limits that depend on moduli parameters; generate inhomogeneous terms in period differential equations.

concepts.label: invertible polynomial
concepts.description: A polynomial with a specific combinatorial structure (typically weighted-homogeneous) whose hypersurface defines a Calabi-Yau variety with well-behaved singularities.

concepts.label: GKZ system
concepts.description: Gelfand-Kapranov-Zelevinsky system of hypergeometric differential equations governing periods of toric hypersurfaces and complete intersections.

concepts.label: Poincaré series
concepts.description: Generating function encoding graded dimensions of cohomology groups or coordinate rings; relates to topological and algebraic invariants of varieties.

concepts.label: hypersurface family
concepts.description: One-parameter or multi-parameter family of hypersurfaces defined by polynomial equations with varying coefficients or structure.

concepts.label: Gauß-Manin connection
concepts.description: Flat connection on the local system of cohomology groups over the parameter space; governs the monodromy and period integrals.

concepts.label: elliptic curve
concepts.description: A smooth projective curve of genus one with a marked point, central object in arithmetic geometry and modular forms.

concepts.label: congruence subgroup
concepts.description: A subgroup of SL(2,ℤ) or a modular group defined by congruence conditions modulo an integer, acting on the upper half-plane.

concepts.label: coefficient series
concepts.description: The sequence of coefficients in the power series expansion of a Picard-Fuchs solution, often exhibiting number-theoretic structure.

concepts.label: integer lattice Z[[t]]
concepts.description: The ring of formal power series with integer coefficients, the natural setting for arithmetic Picard-Fuchs solutions.

concepts.label: Atkin-Swinnerton-Dyer congruence
concepts.description: A congruence relation on modular form coefficients arising from reduction modulo primes, reflecting Hecke eigenvalue structure.

concepts.label: holonomic recurrence
concepts.description: A linear recurrence relation with polynomial coefficients satisfied by a sequence, generalizing the structure of Picard-Fuchs solutions.

concepts.label: asymptotic expansion
concepts.description: An asymptotic expression describing the growth rate of a sequence, of the form u_n ~ ℓ λ^n / n^α for large n.

concepts.label: linear reparametrization
concepts.description: A Möbius transformation or change of coordinates that normalizes the Picard-Fuchs family, enabling integral coefficient structure.

concepts.label: genus zero congruence subgroup
concepts.description: A congruence subgroup whose quotient by the action on the upper half-plane is the Riemann sphere, including index 6 and 12 cases.

concepts.label: torsion-free subgroup
concepts.description: A subgroup of SL(2,ℤ) with no finite-order elements, acting freely on the upper half-plane without fixed points.

concepts.label: holomorphic solution
concepts.description: A solution to the Picard-Fuchs equation that is holomorphic at a specified point (e.g., at infinity or at a regular point).

concepts.label: mirror map
concepts.description: Isomorphism between complex moduli of a Calabi-Yau manifold and Kähler moduli of its mirror dual, enabling instanton sum calculations.

concepts.label: quintic hypersurface
concepts.description: A degree-5 hypersurface in P^4 that is a Calabi-Yau threefold; the archetypal example for mirror symmetry predictions.

concepts.label: Feynman multi-loop integrals
concepts.description: Loop integrals appearing in perturbative quantum field theory, computed via momentum-space Feynman diagrams and characterized by their loop structure and kinematic parameters.

concepts.label: position space approach
concepts.description: Framework for computing loop integrals using unintegrated products of Green's functions in position space, related to momentum-space integrals via Fourier transform.

concepts.label: banana diagram
concepts.description: Feynman graph with a single loop that opens into two branches, appearing as products of propagators in position space; prototype for loop integral analysis.

concepts.label: Green's function
concepts.description: Kernel solving the equation of motion for a free field; in position space, the propagator between two spacetime points in a loop integral.

concepts.label: Fourier transform
concepts.description: Integral transform relating position-space and momentum-space representations of functions; converts position-space differential operators to momentum-space polynomials.

concepts.label: momentum space
concepts.description: Representation of quantum field theory in terms of particle momenta, where loop integrals are most naturally expressed and Picard-Fuchs equations govern their dependence on kinematic invariants.

concepts.label: operator factorization
concepts.description: Decomposition of a differential operator into a product of lower-order operators; appears when Fourier-transforming position-space equations, with Picard-Fuchs operator as a rightmost factor.

concepts.label: operator order
concepts.description: The highest power of the derivative appearing in a differential operator; governed by degree in mass parameters in position space and kinematic dimension in momentum space.

concepts.label: kinematic parameter
concepts.description: Variable or invariant (e.g., squared momenta, masses) on which loop integrals and their Picard-Fuchs equations depend.

concepts.label: singularity structure
concepts.description: The set of singular points and their nature (poles, branch points) in the space of kinematic parameters, governing the form and solutions of associated Picard-Fuchs equations.

concepts.label: QCD scale parameter
concepts.description: Dynamically generated mass scale Λ in gauge theory, related to the running coupling constant and used as independent variable in ODE formulation.

concepts.label: Wronskian
concepts.description: Determinant of a matrix of solutions and their derivatives; for Picard-Fuchs ODEs, it yields new relations among periods, moduli, and QCD scale.

concepts.label: Scaling relation
concepts.description: Homogeneity constraint relating the prepotential to its moduli derivatives, arising from dimensional analysis in N=2 SYM.

concepts.label: SU(2) gauge theory
concepts.description: Minimal non-Abelian N=2 supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory with two independent periods and a Picard-Fuchs ODE of order 2.

concepts.label: SU(3) gauge theory
concepts.description: N=2 supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory with SU(3) gauge group, possessing four independent periods and richer Picard-Fuchs structure.

concepts.label: Appell hypergeometric system
concepts.description: System of partial differential equations in two variables generalizing the classical hypergeometric function; appears in SU(3) Picard-Fuchs equations.

concepts.label: Burchnall's fifth order ODE
concepts.description: Specific fifth-order ordinary differential equation derived from the SU(3) Picard-Fuchs equations in moduli derivatives, published by Burchnall in 1942.

concepts.label: Griffiths technique
concepts.description: A method to compute Picard-Fuchs equations by using the Gauss-Manin connection on the cohomology of families of varieties.

concepts.label: orbifold uniformization
concepts.description: Representation of a complex curve as a quotient of the upper half-plane or unit disk by a discrete group action, characterizing its conformal structure.

concepts.label: mirror-moonshine
concepts.description: Unexpected appearance of modular and moonshine phenomena in mirror symmetry of Calabi-Yau varieties, relating automorphic forms to geometric invariants.

concepts.label: Lian-Yau conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture characterizing when mirror map q-series of Calabi-Yau families are Hauptmoduln, connecting mirror symmetry to modular function theory.

concepts.label: Monodromy matrix
concepts.description: A matrix representation of the action of the fundamental group on the cohomology of a family of varieties as one travels around singular loci in moduli space.

concepts.label: Seiberg-Witten solution
concepts.description: Exact solution to N=2 supersymmetric gauge theories describing the prepotential and low-energy effective action via the moduli space metric.

concepts.label: N=2 supersymmetric gauge theory
concepts.description: A four-dimensional quantum field theory with extended supersymmetry (N=2), whose exact solution is captured by Seiberg-Witten theory.

concepts.label: instanton expansion
concepts.description: Asymptotic series in the gauge coupling arising from non-perturbative contributions of instanton configurations in the path integral.

concepts.label: matter multiplet
concepts.description: A representation of the gauge group containing matter fermions and scalars in a supersymmetric gauge theory.

concepts.label: hypermultiplet matter
concepts.description: Matter representation in N=2 supersymmetry carrying fundamental representation charges under the gauge group.

concepts.label: symbolic computation method
concepts.description: Automated algorithmic technique for deriving Picard-Fuchs equations and computing periods without explicit closed-form expressions.

concepts.label: pure super Yang-Mills
concepts.description: N=2 gauge theory with no matter hypermultiplets; serves as the foundational case for Seiberg-Witten theory.

concepts.label: octic arrangement
concepts.description: A collection of degree-8 hypersurfaces in projective space; defines families of CY varieties via pencil construction.

concepts.label: pencil construction
concepts.description: A one-parameter family of varieties obtained as linear combinations of fixed divisors or hypersurfaces.

concepts.label: mixed-twist construction
concepts.description: A method due to Doran and Malmendier for constructing multi-parameter families of algebraic varieties, particularly K3 surfaces and their mirrors, by twisting with algebraic tori.

concepts.label: lattice polarization
concepts.description: A choice of lattice embedding specifying which algebraic divisors span the Picard lattice, determining the period domain geometry.

concepts.label: elementary lattice
concepts.description: A lattice of the form Z^n with a cyclic torsion component; two-elementary lattices have 2-torsion and are often used in polarization extensions.

concepts.label: resonant hypergeometric system
concepts.description: A hypergeometric differential system where the exponent differences satisfy resonance conditions, leading to logarithmic solutions and special monodromy.

concepts.label: non-resonant GKZ system
concepts.description: A GKZ system where the parameter does not satisfy resonance conditions, ensuring existence of power-series or Mellin-Barnes solutions without logarithmic terms.

concepts.label: Mellin-Barnes integral
concepts.description: A multi-dimensional contour integral representation of hypergeometric functions, providing absolutely convergent solutions to differential systems in certain parameter regimes.

concepts.label: monomial forms
concepts.description: Differential forms expressed as products of monomial terms; used as basis elements for constructing explicit Picard-Fuchs systems.

concepts.label: majorant coefficients
concepts.description: Upper bounds on the magnitude of coefficients in differential equations, providing analytic control over growth rates.

concepts.label: Hilbert 16th problem
concepts.description: Classical problem on the maximum number of limit cycles in polynomial vector fields; tangential version concerns zeros of Abelian integrals.

concepts.label: Hamiltonian
concepts.description: Function defining a level-set family of algebraic curves; critical values parametrize degenerate fibers.

concepts.label: equivariant formulation
concepts.description: Extension of a mathematical problem to account for group symmetry actions; applies when varieties have automorphisms.

concepts.label: polynomial non-homogeneity
concepts.description: Measure of deviation from homogeneous structure in multivariate complex polynomials; related to growth and zero distribution.

concepts.label: zero counting bounds
concepts.description: Upper estimates for the number of real or complex zeros of Abelian integrals in a given region.

concepts.label: WKB approximation
concepts.description: Semi-classical method for solving quantum-mechanical problems by expanding the action as a series in powers of ℏ.

concepts.label: classical action
concepts.description: The integral ∫p dq representing the classical trajectory in phase space; zeroth-order term in WKB expansion.

concepts.label: higher-order WKB corrections
concepts.description: Quantum corrections to the classical action arising from higher-order terms in the WKB series expansion beyond the zeroth order.

concepts.label: sextic double-well potential
concepts.description: A one-dimensional potential with form V(x) = αx⁶ + βx⁴ exhibiting two minima; used as a test case for WKB methods.

concepts.label: Lamé potential
concepts.description: A periodic potential related to elliptic functions; arises in classical mechanics and quantum mechanical bound-state problems.

concepts.label: energy parameter
concepts.description: The energy E appearing as a variable in the Picard-Fuchs differential equation, enabling parametric evaluation of integrals.

concepts.label: integral evaluation
concepts.description: The computation of definite or indefinite integrals; the primary application of Picard-Fuchs equations avoiding direct integration.

concepts.label: semi-classical quantisation
concepts.description: Quantum mechanical approach treating quantum systems as perturbations around classical trajectories, bridging classical and quantum mechanics.

concepts.label: five-dimensional SUSY gauge theory
concepts.description: Supersymmetric gauge theory in five dimensions, which upon circle compactification yields an effective four-dimensional N=2 theory.

concepts.label: circle compactification
concepts.description: Dimensional reduction by compactifying one spatial dimension on a circle of radius R, generating Kaluza-Klein modes and an effective 4D theory.

concepts.label: XXZ spin chain
concepts.description: Integrable spin-1/2 system with anisotropic XY and Ising interactions; its spectral properties relate to the Picard-Fuchs equation via integrable systems.

concepts.label: Toda chain
concepts.description: Integrable system of particles with exponential nearest-neighbor interactions; the relativistic version appears in Nekrasov's approach to 5D gauge theory.

concepts.label: instanton corrections
concepts.description: Non-perturbative contributions to the prepotential from solitonic configurations (four-dimensional instantons) wrapping the compactification circle.

concepts.label: M theory compactification
concepts.description: Eleven-dimensional supergravity theory compactified on a Calabi-Yau threefold or other geometries; dual to type IIA string theory.

concepts.label: normal function
concepts.description: A holomorphic map from the moduli space to ℂ/ℤ arising from integration of a (n-1,0)-form over a family of rational curves, capturing arithmetic information.

concepts.label: mirror quintic
concepts.description: The mirror Calabi-Yau threefold dual to a generic quintic hypersurface in ℂℙ⁴, obtained via mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: van Geemen family
concepts.description: A one-parameter family of lines on the mirror quintic, parametrized by complex structure moduli.

concepts.label: large complex structure
concepts.description: A limit point in moduli space where the Picard-Fuchs equation is regular and admits a power-series solution around infinity.

concepts.label: conifold point
concepts.description: A singular point in moduli space where the Calabi-Yau develops a nodal singularity; the Picard-Fuchs equation is logarithmically singular.

concepts.label: open string discriminant
concepts.description: A divisor in moduli space where open string instantons become massless, signalling boundary instability in D-brane configurations.

concepts.label: di-logarithm
concepts.description: A special function Li₂(z) = -∫₀^z (log(1-t)/t)dt arising as the limiting value of normal functions and periods at MUM points.

concepts.label: inhomogeneous PF
concepts.description: A Picard-Fuchs system with a non-trivial right-hand side, arising from differentiation of normal functions rather than periods alone.

concepts.label: Constraint Programming
concepts.description: Computational paradigm for solving combinatorial problems by declaratively specifying constraints and using constraint propagation and search.

concepts.label: Global constraint
concepts.description: A constraint involving multiple variables with a complex structure; requires specialized filtering algorithms for efficient propagation.

concepts.label: Cardinality constraint
concepts.description: Global constraint specifying the number of times each value must appear in assignments to a set of variables.

concepts.label: All different constraint
concepts.description: Global constraint requiring that all variables in a set take distinct values; a special case of cardinality constraint.

concepts.label: Arc consistency
concepts.description: Filtering algorithm that removes values from variable domains that cannot appear in any solution to the constraint.

concepts.label: Shortest path
concepts.description: Minimum-cost path between two nodes in a weighted graph; central to computing arc consistency for cardinality constraints with costs.

concepts.label: Landmark
concepts.description: Intermediate waypoint in a graph used to compute upper bounds on shortest paths between node pairs via triangle inequality.

concepts.label: Cost bound
concepts.description: Upper limit on the total sum of assignment costs in a cardinality constraint; enforced during filtering.

concepts.label: Filtering algorithm
concepts.description: Algorithm that removes infeasible values from variable domains by enforcing a consistency property.

concepts.label: Preprocessing
concepts.description: Computational phase prior to search that simplifies the constraint network and computes reusable information like landmark-based path bounds.

concepts.label: mixed Hodge module
concepts.description: Categorical object extending mixed Hodge structures with a coherent sheaf underlying structure, closed under standard operations.

concepts.label: higher Chow groups
concepts.description: Generalization of classical Chow groups incorporating information about algebraic cycles and their relations via higher-dimensional polytopes.

concepts.label: extension of D-modules
concepts.description: A coherent D-module structure over a base variety parametrizing variations of algebraic structures.

concepts.label: extension of local systems
concepts.description: A filtered connection on a vector bundle encoding monodromy and flat structure on a quasi-projective base.

concepts.label: algebraic cycle
concepts.description: Formal linear combination of irreducible closed subvarieties of a given codimension on an algebraic variety.

concepts.label: Hodge bundle
concepts.description: Vector bundle whose fibers are Hodge structures, naturally equipped with a Gauss-Manin connection.

concepts.label: coherent sheaf
concepts.description: Sheaf of modules over the structure sheaf of an algebraic variety, fundamental object in algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: Griffiths-Dwork reduction
concepts.description: Algorithm for computing Picard-Fuchs equations of hypersurface integrals by successive differentiation and elimination.

concepts.label: Relative period
concepts.description: Period of an algebraic variety relative to a subvariety, conjectured to match Feynman integrals in appropriate limits.

concepts.label: Sunset integral
concepts.description: Two-loop three-point Feynman integral with massive propagators; conjectured to satisfy Picard-Fuchs equations of Calabi-Yau periods.

concepts.label: Loop order
concepts.description: Number of independent loop integrations in a Feynman diagram; higher orders require higher-degree Picard-Fuchs operators.

concepts.label: Elliptic solution
concepts.description: Picard-Fuchs equation solution involving elliptic integrals or functions; arises for certain two-loop Feynman integral topologies.

concepts.label: Liouvillian solution
concepts.description: Picard-Fuchs equation solution expressible in terms of elementary functions and their iterated integrals.

concepts.label: Operator factorisation
