concepts.description: Algorithmic decomposition of a differential operator into irreducible factors; enables determination of minimal-order operators.

concepts.label: classical Lie gauge groups
concepts.description: Unitary, orthogonal, and symplectic groups (SU(N), SO(N), Sp(N)) serving as gauge symmetries in Yang-Mills theories.

concepts.label: massless hypermultiplet
concepts.description: Matter representation in N=2 theory with zero mass, preserved by conformal symmetry, crucial for asymptotic freedom.

concepts.label: asymptotic freedom
concepts.description: Running coupling constant decreases at high energy scales; property ensuring theory remains weakly-coupled at UV.

concepts.label: orientifold
concepts.description: String theory construction combining orientifold involution with background fluxes and D-brane configurations to break supersymmetry and generate chiral matter.

concepts.label: intersecting D-branes
concepts.description: Configuration of multiple D-branes wrapping distinct cycles whose intersections host chiral fermion zero-modes; fundamental mechanism for generating Standard Model-like spectra.

concepts.label: topological invariants
concepts.description: Characteristic numbers (Chern classes, intersection numbers, Hodge numbers) that classify geometric structures; determine chiral and vector-like matter multiplicities.

concepts.label: orbifold
concepts.description: Singular geometric quotient by discrete group action; source of examples of CY3 and K3 geometries studied via resolution and deformation.

concepts.label: Green-Schwarz mechanism
concepts.description: Anomaly cancellation via coupling of axion-like field to Chern-Simons form; ensures consistency of D-brane theories at loop level.

concepts.label: G2 manifold
concepts.description: Seven-dimensional Riemannian manifold with holonomy group G₂; natural target for M-theory compactification corresponding to type IIA on CY3.

concepts.label: anti-D-brane
concepts.description: An antibrane is the antimatter counterpart of a D-brane in string theory, carrying opposite charge and tension.

concepts.label: orientifold plane
concepts.description: A non-dynamical object in type II string theory arising from the orientifold projection; carries both RR and NS charges.

concepts.label: tachyon instability
concepts.description: A runaway instability in string theory caused by a negative-mass-squared state signaling an inconsistent configuration.

concepts.label: antibrane creation
concepts.description: Dynamic generation of an additional anti-D-brane at strong coupling as a consequence of instability or phase transition.

concepts.label: RR charge
concepts.description: Ramond-Ramond charge carried by D-branes and O-planes; quantised in units of the fundamental string charge.

concepts.label: NS charge
concepts.description: Neveu-Schwarz charge associated with gravitational effects and tension in string theory backgrounds.

concepts.label: gauge-Higgs unification
concepts.description: A scenario where the Higgs boson emerges as the extra-dimensional component of a gauge field in higher-dimensional gauge theory.

concepts.label: Higgs decay
concepts.description: The spontaneous decomposition of a Higgs boson into lighter particles, with branching ratios sensitive to Yukawa couplings and gauge structure.

concepts.label: signal strength
concepts.description: Measured production cross-section and decay rate of the Higgs boson relative to Standard Model predictions; quantifies deviations in collider phenomenology.

concepts.label: tau Yukawa
concepts.description: The coupling constant governing tau lepton mass generation through interaction with the Higgs boson.

concepts.label: bottom Yukawa
concepts.description: The coupling constant governing bottom quark mass generation through interaction with the Higgs boson.

concepts.label: gauge field
concepts.description: A quantum field mediating fundamental interactions, transforming under gauge symmetries and coupling to fermions and scalars.

concepts.label: tensionless branes
concepts.description: BPS or non-BPS brane configurations with vanishing tension, arising as topological defects in non-commutative field theory on D-branes.

concepts.label: non-BPS D-branes
concepts.description: D-branes that do not saturate the Bogomol'nyi bound; unstable under closed-string tachyon condensation but support topological solitons.

concepts.label: discrete gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Finite gauge transformation group acting on brane worldvolume or bulk; quotients by discrete subgroups of continuous gauge groups.

concepts.label: non-commutative field theory
concepts.description: Quantum field theory on spacetime with non-commuting coordinates [x^μ, x^ν] = iθ^{μν}; arises naturally on D-brane worldvolumes in strong B-field backgrounds.

concepts.label: D(2p)-branes
concepts.description: Even-dimensional D-branes in IIA string theory (D0, D2, D4, D6, D8); wrap p-cycles in the compactification.

concepts.label: non-BPS D9-brane
concepts.description: Space-filling non-BPS D-brane in ten-dimensional IIA theory; carries RR charge but is classically unstable to tachyon condensation.

concepts.label: tachyon condensation
concepts.description: Decay process of unstable D-branes via rolling of the tachyonic scalar field; relevant to the construction of lower-dimensional branes.

concepts.label: gauge equivalence
concepts.description: Identification of two field configurations or brane states related by a gauge transformation; leaves physical observables invariant.

concepts.label: vacuum configuration
concepts.description: Ground state of a field theory or brane system; lowest-energy or classically stable state.

concepts.label: worldvolume dynamics
concepts.description: Effective field theory governing fluctuations and solitons on a brane worldvolume.

concepts.label: field-dependent Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: A Yukawa coupling whose strength varies with the background scalar field values, exhibiting non-trivial renormalization group flow even when conventional perturbative analysis predicts no flow.

concepts.label: renormalization group flow
concepts.description: Evolution of coupling constants and correlation functions with respect to the energy scale (RG scale) governed by the renormalization group equations.

concepts.label: three flavor quark-meson model
concepts.description: Effective quantum field theory incorporating three quark flavors coupled to scalar and pseudoscalar meson fields; used to study chiral symmetry breaking and low-energy QCD dynamics.

concepts.label: functional renormalization group
concepts.description: Non-perturbative renormalization technique based on the exact RG equation for the effective average action; tracks the flow of all couplings including those generating quantum fluctuations.

concepts.label: pseudoscalar field
concepts.description: Quantum field transforming as a Lorentz pseudoscalar (odd under parity); couples to fermions via pseudovector Yukawa-like interactions in chiral models.

concepts.label: chirally invariant operator
concepts.description: Local operator in the effective action that respects chiral symmetry; generated by quantum fluctuations and must be distinguished from explicit Yukawa couplings.

concepts.label: one-loop renormalization
concepts.description: Perturbative renormalization calculation at leading order in loop expansion, involving single virtual particle loops; fails to capture field-dependent effects in certain models.

concepts.label: field rescaling
concepts.description: Redefinition of quantum fields by a scale factor; trivial field rescaling preserves the functional form of couplings, but field-dependent rescalings can induce non-trivial RG flow.

concepts.label: factorized torus
concepts.description: A product structure T⁶ = T² × T² × T² where the six-torus is decomposed into three two-dimensional tori, simplifying the geometry of D-brane intersections.

concepts.label: dynamical generation
concepts.description: A mechanism in which couplings or structures emerge dynamically from geometry and dynamics rather than being imposed by hand in the model.

concepts.label: D-brane models
concepts.description: String theory construction where particle physics arises from open strings ending on Dp-branes in compactified dimensions.

concepts.label: magnetized D-branes
concepts.description: D-branes with background magnetic flux threading their worldvolume, generating chiral fermions and family replication.

concepts.label: toroidal orientifold
concepts.description: String compactification on a torus with orientifold projection, reducing supersymmetry and fixing D-brane configurations.

concepts.label: massive U(1) symmetry
concepts.description: Abelian gauge symmetry that acquires mass through the Green-Schwarz mechanism, constraining couplings but allowing some interactions.

concepts.label: BRST symmetry
concepts.description: Gauge symmetry of covariant quantization in superstring theory that ensures consistency of the quantum theory and closure of the operator algebra.

concepts.label: superstring covariant quantization
concepts.description: Framework for quantizing superstrings while maintaining manifest Lorentz covariance through BRST formalism without breaking symmetries.

concepts.label: Dp-branes
concepts.description: Extended objects in string theory on which open strings can end, characterized by p spatial dimensions and carrying RR charge.

concepts.label: Wess-Zumino terms
concepts.description: Fermionic couplings in the effective action of D-branes that couple to RR form fields and ensure anomaly cancellation.

concepts.label: boundary states
concepts.description: Quantum states in closed string theory that encode the boundary conditions imposed by D-branes on open string fields.

concepts.label: pure spinors
concepts.description: Mathematical objects used in an alternative formulation of superstring quantization providing an explicit covariant approach to ghost sectors.

concepts.label: open strings
concepts.description: String excitations with free endpoints that can terminate on D-branes, governed by boundary conditions.

concepts.label: super Dp-branes
concepts.description: D-branes in superstring theory carrying supersymmetric structure with fermionic zero modes and RR charges.

concepts.label: Dirac neutrinos
concepts.description: Massive fermions where neutrinos have distinct particle and antiparticle states, without Majorana mass terms.

concepts.label: Anomaly-free condition
concepts.description: Quantum consistency requirement that triangle anomalies involving gauge currents and global symmetries vanish.

concepts.label: D-brane instanton
concepts.description: Non-perturbative topological object wrapping cycles in the geometry; generates exponentially suppressed corrections to the effective field theory superpotential.

concepts.label: Seiberg duality
concepts.description: Infrared equivalence between two different gauge theories with different gauge groups, ranks, and matter content but identical low-energy dynamics.

concepts.label: Seiberg duality cascade
concepts.description: Successive application of Seiberg duality transformations at decreasing energy scales, flowing from UV to IR through a sequence of dual theories.

concepts.label: Orientifold singularity
concepts.description: Orbifold fixed point in a spacetime with orientifold projection, where the metric degenerates and supports localized D-branes and intersecting gauge theories.

concepts.label: Chiral quiver theory
concepts.description: Four-dimensional gauge theory arising from D-branes at singularities, whose matter content violates left-right symmetry and exhibits chiral fermions.

concepts.label: Fermion zero mode
concepts.description: Massless fermionic excitation bound to an instanton, whose presence or absence is protected by topology and determines whether the instanton can generate superpotential terms.

concepts.label: Conformal field theory
concepts.description: Quantum field theory invariant under the full conformal group, exhibiting scale invariance and possessing a well-defined operator product expansion.

concepts.label: Conformal invariance
concepts.description: Symmetry of a field theory under conformal transformations (Weyl rescalings combined with translations and rotations); metric invariant up to local rescaling.

concepts.label: Gauge theory dynamics
concepts.description: Non-perturbative strong coupling phenomena in gauge theories, including asymptotic freedom, confinement, and dynamical symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Topological protection
concepts.description: Stability of a quantum state or process against small perturbations due to its classification by topological invariants rather than detailed dynamics.

concepts.label: R-R fields
concepts.description: Ramond-Ramond gauge fields in string theory that couple to D-branes and orientifold planes, classified by form degree.

concepts.label: NS-NS fields
concepts.description: Neveu-Schwarz sector background fields in string theory including the metric, dilaton, and B-field that couple universally to all branes.

concepts.label: scattering amplitude
concepts.description: Quantum amplitude for particle/string interactions computed via correlation functions on the worldsheet or in effective field theory.

concepts.label: anomalous coupling
concepts.description: Non-minimal coupling in the effective action arising from quantum anomalies, characterized by higher-derivative gravitational terms.

concepts.label: Pontrjagin class
concepts.description: Characteristic class of the tangent bundle measuring curvature obstructions, appearing in D-brane and orientifold anomaly polynomials.

concepts.label: D9-brane
concepts.description: Spacetime-filling D-brane in ten-dimensional string theory that couples to all R-R and NS-NS fields.

concepts.label: O9-plane
concepts.description: Spacetime-filling orientifold plane in ten-dimensional string theory resulting from worldsheet parity projection.

concepts.label: orientifold action
concepts.description: Effective action for orientifold planes encoding their coupling to curvature, dilaton, and R-R fields in string compactifications.

concepts.label: intersecting D-brane model
concepts.description: Type IIA string compactification where matter arises from open strings stretched between stacks of D-branes at various angles.

concepts.label: preon dynamics
concepts.description: Confinement of sub-quark constituents (preons) at high energy scales; generates effective four-generation quark-lepton sector at low scales.

concepts.label: string-level interaction
concepts.description: Higher-dimensional coupling among open string modes that survives the low-energy effective field theory limit.

concepts.label: composite fermion
concepts.description: Bound state of preons arising from confinement dynamics; identified with quarks and leptons at phenomenological scales.

concepts.label: baryon triality
concepts.description: A discrete Z₃ gauge symmetry that emerges from U(1) breaking and constrains baryon-number violating couplings in unified models.

concepts.label: Stückelberg coupling
concepts.description: A mass-generating mechanism for gauge fields that breaks continuous U(1) symmetries down to discrete subgroups without elementary scalar fields.

concepts.label: F-theory GUT
concepts.description: Grand unified theory constructed in twelve-dimensional F-theory framework, typically realizing SU(5) unification with enhanced geometric control.

concepts.label: anomaly-free discrete symmetry
concepts.description: A discrete gauge symmetry whose gauging does not lead to quantum anomalies in matter representations.

concepts.label: continuous U(1) gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Abelian gauge symmetry of rank one; can be broken to discrete subgroups via Stückelberg mechanism in string theory.

concepts.label: quantum gravity consistency
concepts.description: Requirement that effective field theories be consistent with full quantum gravity; constrains global symmetries and motivates gauged discrete symmetries.

concepts.label: Standard Model spectrum
concepts.description: The complete set of particle content and gauge quantum numbers of the Standard Model; target spectrum for brane model building.

concepts.label: Type IIB orientifold
concepts.description: String compactification obtained by gauging a worldsheet parity involution in Type IIB theory, introducing orientifold planes as sources of RR and NSNS charge.

concepts.label: Orientifold planes
concepts.description: Loci fixed by the orientifold projection in Type IIB string compactifications, acting as sources of tadpole charge and constraints on D-brane configurations.

concepts.label: Equivariant KK-theory
concepts.description: Kasparov KK-theory incorporating symmetry actions via equivariance, classifying D-branes in symmetric configurations.

concepts.label: D-brane classification
concepts.description: Systematic enumeration and characterization of D-brane configurations in string compactifications using topological and K-theoretic methods.

concepts.label: Type I superstring
concepts.description: Unoriented Type II superstring theory obtained by modding out the worldsheet parity; its D-branes are a limit of Type IIB orientifolds.

concepts.label: Orbifold singularities
concepts.description: Geometric singularities arising from identifications by discrete group actions; string theory on orbifolds develops twisted sectors and fractional D-branes.

concepts.label: Unstable D-brane systems
concepts.description: Configurations of D-branes and anti-D-branes whose worldvolume gauge theory contains tachyonic modes signalling decay to closed-string backgrounds.

concepts.label: Worldvolume gauge theory
concepts.description: Effective gauge theory living on the worldvolume of D-branes, determined by open-string spectrum and interaction terms.

concepts.label: Clifford algebras
concepts.description: Associative algebras encoding orthogonal geometry; used to construct spinor representations and compute D-brane intersection properties.

concepts.label: Tadpole cancellation
concepts.description: Consistency condition requiring net RR charge from D-branes and O-planes to vanish in a compact space.

concepts.label: Transformation properties
concepts.description: How fields in the effective low-energy theory transform under the spacetime and internal symmetries of the string compactification.

concepts.label: D-brane model
concepts.description: String theory framework using D-branes on toroidal orientifolds to construct low-energy effective field theories with realistic particle content.

concepts.label: SM singlet scalar
concepts.description: Scalar particle carrying no Standard Model gauge quantum numbers; can have renormalisable couplings to other fields.

concepts.label: vector-like quarks
concepts.description: Heavy fermions transforming as vector representations under SU(3)_c with both left and right chiralities; couple to SM Higgs.

concepts.label: vector-like leptons
concepts.description: Heavy fermions transforming as vector representations under electroweak gauge groups; vector-like partners to SM leptons.

concepts.label: gluon fusion
concepts.description: Production mechanism where a neutral scalar couples to Standard Model gluons via heavy quark loops.

concepts.label: diphoton decay
concepts.description: Process where a resonance decays to two photons; typically proceeds through loops involving charged particles.

concepts.label: gauge coupling unification
concepts.description: Requirement that Standard Model gauge couplings converge to a single value at high energy; criterion for grand unification.

concepts.label: SU(5) multiplet
concepts.description: Irreducible representation of the SU(5) grand unification group; standard matter fits in 5⊕10 representations.

concepts.label: diphoton excess
concepts.description: Experimental observation of an enhancement in diphoton event rate above Standard Model background at a specific invariant mass.

concepts.label: proton-proton collision
concepts.description: High-energy collision event between two protons at hadron colliders; primary production mechanism for new particles.

concepts.label: Yukawa point
concepts.description: Locus in the moduli space of F-theory models where matter curves meet and Yukawa couplings localize geometrically.

concepts.label: non-resolvable cycle
concepts.description: Holomorphic cycle in a singular geometry that does not lift to a divisor in the resolved manifold; supports non-perturbative D-brane contributions.

concepts.label: strong coupling limit
concepts.description: Regime where string coupling gs → ∞, transitioning from weakly-coupled IIB description to M-theory on an elliptic fibration.

concepts.label: Georgi-Glashow model
concepts.description: Minimal SU(5) GUT implementation with minimal Higgs sector, predicting proton decay at accessible rates.

concepts.label: Flipped SU(5)
concepts.description: Alternative SU(5) GUT variant with different matter assignments and gauge coupling unification properties.

concepts.label: D-brane quiver
concepts.description: Directed graph encoding gauge symmetry, matter content, and interactions of multiple D-brane stacks in compactification.

concepts.label: U(1) D-brane
concepts.description: Single D-brane or U(1) stack providing additional abelian gauge symmetry to constrain couplings and suppress unwanted interactions.

concepts.label: RCFT
concepts.description: Rational Conformal Field Theory; worldsheet description used to engineer globally consistent D-brane models on non-trivial cycles.

concepts.label: tilted torus
concepts.description: A toroidal compactification where D-branes are oriented at non-trivial angles relative to the lattice basis vectors.

concepts.label: left-right symmetric model
concepts.description: A grand unified extension of the Standard Model with manifest left-right symmetry, containing SU(2)_L × SU(2)_R × U(1)_B-L gauge structure.

concepts.label: fractional brane
concepts.description: A D-brane configuration at a singular point of an orbifold, carrying fractional quantum numbers and reduced multiplicity.

concepts.label: stringy symmetry
concepts.description: A discrete symmetry that arises from the string geometry and has no obvious field-theory counterpart, constraining the low-energy effective action.

concepts.label: gauged linear sigma model
concepts.description: 2D N=(2,2) supersymmetric gauge theory used to describe the quantum geometry of Calabi-Yau manifolds and their moduli spaces.

concepts.label: Kaehler moduli
concepts.description: Geometric parameters controlling the size and shape of the Calabi-Yau; complex structure dual to divisor volumes.

concepts.label: orientifold-invariant D-branes
concepts.description: D-brane configurations that are self-dual under the parity involution and consistent with the orientifold projection.

concepts.label: probe brane
concepts.description: Test D-brane whose interaction with a background (e.g. orientifold plane) is used to extract physical data without backreaction.

concepts.label: orientifold type
concepts.description: Discrete classification (SO versus Sp) of orientifold planes determined by the action on the boundary state Chan-Paton factors.

concepts.label: vector structure
concepts.description: Topological property of a spin manifold allowing consistent coupling to vector bundles; determines consistency of D-brane charges on CY.

concepts.label: parity action on D-branes
concepts.description: The representation of the orientifold involution on the Chan-Paton factors and boundary conditions of open-string states.

concepts.label: real slice of moduli space
concepts.description: Locus of points in the complex moduli space preserving a real structure; defines geometric phases with distinct topological properties.

concepts.label: discrete torsion
concepts.description: A choice of phases in the orbifold action that affects consistency of open-string sectors and D-brane representations.

concepts.label: projective representation
concepts.description: A group representation where multiplication is defined up to phase factors, arising in orbifold theories with discrete torsion.

concepts.label: conventional representation
concepts.description: A standard linear group representation without phase ambiguity, corresponding to ordinary D-branes in orbifold theories.

concepts.label: orbifold group
concepts.description: The discrete symmetry group acting on a geometric space to generate the orbifold singularity.

concepts.label: BPS branes
concepts.description: D-branes that preserve a fraction of supersymmetry and are protected from decay by a central charge bound.

concepts.label: non-BPS branes
concepts.description: D-branes that break supersymmetry and may decay; their existence is constrained by consistency conditions in orbifold theories.

concepts.label: twisted R-R potentials
concepts.description: Ramond-Ramond gauge fields arising from twisted sectors of an orbifold that couple to non-BPS branes.

concepts.label: C³/Z_N × Z_N orbifold
concepts.description: A quotient of three-dimensional complex space by a product abelian group of order N²; the primary geometry studied.

concepts.label: minimal discrete torsion
concepts.description: The simplest non-trivial choice of phase structure in orbifold theories, typically arising for Z_N actions with N > 2.

concepts.label: gauge contribution
concepts.description: Contribution to the beta function arising from gauge field loop diagrams and gauge-fermion interactions.

concepts.label: 1/N_F expansion
concepts.description: Asymptotic expansion in inverse powers of the number of heavy vector-like fermions; systematic approximation scheme for large N_F.

concepts.label: abelian gauge group
concepts.description: Commutative gauge symmetry (e.g., U(1)) characterized by gauge bosons that do not self-interact.

concepts.label: non-abelian gauge group
concepts.description: Non-commutative gauge symmetry (e.g., SU(N)) where gauge bosons carry charge and self-interact.

concepts.label: UV behavior
concepts.description: Behavior of coupling constants at high energies (ultraviolet limit); pathological UV behavior refers to unbounded growth.

concepts.label: resummed expression
concepts.description: Infinite series of coupling constants summed to all orders, yielding a closed analytical form free of divergences.

concepts.label: pole structure
concepts.description: Location of singularities in a function; poles in beta functions indicate RG fixed points or coupling discontinuities.

concepts.label: Z₂ × Z₂ orientifold
concepts.description: A type IIB string theory compactification with orientifold projection and Z₂ × Z₂ orbifold symmetry acting on extra dimensions.

concepts.label: K-theory
concepts.description: Topological invariant classifying D-brane charge quantization in spacetime; K-theory groups parametrize consistent brane configurations.

concepts.label: torsion K-theory
concepts.description: The torsion subgroup of K-theory capturing non-trivial D-brane charges that are invisible to classical de Rham cohomology.

concepts.label: D-brane probes
concepts.description: Test D-branes used to measure ambient geometry and charges indirectly via their coupling to bulk fields and defects.

concepts.label: stability regions
concepts.description: Regions in moduli space where D-branes remain classically or quantum mechanically stable against decay or tachyon condensation.

concepts.label: charge quantization
concepts.description: The discrete set of allowed D-brane charges in a given compactification, encoded and constrained by K-theory groups.

concepts.label: Intersecting D6-branes
concepts.description: D6-dimensional branes placed at angles in a toroidal compactification, whose intersections generate chiral fermion families.

concepts.label: Stringy instanton
concepts.description: Non-perturbative Euclidean D-brane wrapping contributing exponentially suppressed but non-vanishing amplitudes to the superpotential.

concepts.label: Non-perturbative Yukawa
concepts.description: Yukawa coupling induced at non-perturbative level by instanton effects, not suppressed by tree-level U(1) selection rules.

concepts.label: MSSM-like compactification
concepts.description: String theory vacua engineering an effective low-energy theory with spectrum and interactions resembling the Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model.

concepts.label: Rigid O(1) instanton
concepts.description: Euclidean wrapped brane configuration with O(1) gauge bundle whose moduli space is discrete or zero-dimensional.

concepts.label: T⁶/Z₂×Z₂′ toroidal orientifold
concepts.description: Six-dimensional toroidal compactification modded by discrete symmetry group, admitting D6-brane constructions with torsion.

concepts.label: Doubled Higgs system
concepts.description: Extended Higgs sector with multiple doublet pairs engineered to suppress instanton-generated dangerous μ-terms while preserving Yukawa couplings.

concepts.label: IIB dual
concepts.description: Type IIB string compactification dual to Type IIA orientifold via mirror symmetry, described by magnetized D9/D7-branes.

concepts.label: Magnetized D7/D9-branes
concepts.description: Type IIB branes carrying magnetized U(1) gauge flux, providing dual description of intersecting D6-brane stacks.

concepts.label: Chiral fermion family
concepts.description: Repeated generation of Standard Model fermions arising from D6-brane intersections with multiplicity given by intersection number.

concepts.label: brane construction
concepts.description: A method for realizing gauge theories and their symmetries using open strings attached to D-branes in string theory.

concepts.label: SO(2n) global symmetry
concepts.description: A global orthogonal Lie group symmetry acting on the flavor or global structure of a gauge theory.

concepts.label: gauge theory
concepts.description: A quantum field theory whose dynamics are governed by local gauge symmetries and interactions mediated by gauge bosons.

concepts.label: N=4 gauge theory
concepts.description: A maximally supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory in three dimensions with four supercharges.

concepts.label: Brane Box Model
concepts.description: A brane construction method for three-dimensional gauge theories using a periodic grid of D-branes and orientifold planes.

concepts.label: D_n singularity
concepts.description: A quotient singularity of type C²/Γ where Γ is the dihedral group D_n, relevant in orbifold constructions.

concepts.label: ON⁰ plane
concepts.description: An orientifold O-plane of type N=0 that can support stuck D-brane configurations.

concepts.label: stuck D-brane
concepts.description: A D-brane configuration localized at a fixed point or singularity of an orientifold quotient, unable to move freely.

concepts.label: R-parity violation
concepts.description: Breaking of discrete R-parity symmetry leading to rapid proton decay and excluded phenomenology in low-energy SUSY models.

concepts.label: mu-term
concepts.description: Superpotential mass parameter coupling the two Higgs doublets in the MSSM; naturally suppressed in some string constructions.

concepts.label: perturbative coupling
concepts.description: Yukawa interaction forbidden at tree level by selection rules (e.g., global symmetries) but potentially generated by nonperturbative effects.

concepts.label: phenomenological consistency
concepts.description: Requirement that low-energy effective theory agrees with Standard Model particle spectrum and couplings within experimental precision.

concepts.label: Coxeter group
concepts.description: Abstract group generated by reflections, defined by relations on pairs of generators (m_ij parameters).

concepts.label: strongly real element
concepts.description: Group element that can be expressed as a product of involutions (elements of order 2).

concepts.label: excess
concepts.description: For a strongly real element w, the minimum number of involutions needed in any factorization w = t₁t₂...tₖ.

concepts.label: reflection excess
concepts.description: For finite Coxeter groups, the minimum number of reflections needed to express an element as a product of reflections.

concepts.label: minimal length
concepts.description: The minimum word length of an element within its conjugacy class with respect to the standard generating set.

concepts.label: finite Coxeter group
concepts.description: Coxeter group with finite order; classification includes dihedral groups, symmetric groups, and exceptional types.

concepts.label: involution
concepts.description: Group element of order 2, satisfying t² = 1; generates a two-element subgroup.

concepts.label: zero excess theorem
concepts.description: Main result: for finite Coxeter groups, every conjugacy class contains an element with zero excess and minimal length.

concepts.label: line bundle cohomology
concepts.description: Sheaf cohomology groups H^i(X, L) measuring sections and higher extensions of holomorphic line bundles over algebraic varieties.

concepts.label: flop transition
concepts.description: Birational transformation connecting two Calabi-Yau manifolds by contracting and then flopping a rational curve, preserving Hodge numbers.

concepts.label: projective space product
concepts.description: Ambient toric variety constructed as a product P^{n₁} × P^{n₂} × ... in which complete intersection CY manifolds are realized.

concepts.label: zeroth cohomology
concepts.description: Global sections H^0(X, L) of a line bundle; the space of holomorphic functions with prescribed pole/zero structure.

concepts.label: Étale cohomology
concepts.description: A Weil cohomology theory for algebraic varieties over fields of positive characteristic and finite fields, computing ℓ-adic Galois modules.

concepts.label: Frobenius eigenvalue
concepts.description: An eigenvalue of the Frobenius endomorphism acting on étale cohomology, determining the reduction of the Galois representation modulo primes.

concepts.label: QCD at hadron colliders
concepts.description: Precision tests of Quantum Chromodynamics through high-transverse momentum processes at hadron collider experiments.

concepts.label: Parton Distribution Functions
concepts.description: Probability distributions describing the momentum fraction carried by quarks and gluons inside hadrons; fundamental input for collider predictions.

concepts.label: jet definitions
concepts.description: Standardized algorithms and criteria for identifying and clustering final-state partons into observable jet objects at hadron colliders.

concepts.label: underlying event
concepts.description: The soft QCD processes and beam-remnant interactions that accompany the hard scattering event in hadron collisions.

concepts.label: Monte Carlo tunes
concepts.description: Optimization of free parameters in Monte Carlo event generators to match experimental observations of QCD observables.

concepts.label: diffractive physics
concepts.description: Elastic and quasi-elastic scattering processes at hadron colliders characterized by momentum-transfer-dependent cross-sections and rapidity gaps.

concepts.label: Tevatron
concepts.description: Fermilab's proton-antiproton collider operating at 1.96 TeV center-of-mass energy, providing precision QCD measurements in Run 2.

concepts.label: Large Hadron Collider
concepts.description: CERN's proton-proton collider designed as a discovery machine for new physics, requiring precise understanding of QCD backgrounds.

concepts.label: precision QCD tests
concepts.description: Measurements comparing theoretical predictions and experimental data at the few-percent accuracy level to validate QCD calculations.

concepts.label: high-transverse momentum data
concepts.description: Experimental measurements of processes with large momentum transfer perpendicular to the beam axis, suppressing soft QCD backgrounds.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau cap
concepts.description: A symplectic manifold with Calabi-Yau structure used as an obstruction to exact symplectic fillings of contact manifolds.

concepts.label: exact filling
concepts.description: A compact symplectic manifold whose boundary is a given contact manifold, equipped with a primitive exact symplectic form.

concepts.label: contact 3-manifold
concepts.description: A 3-dimensional manifold equipped with a contact structure, the odd-dimensional analogue of symplectic geometry.

concepts.label: disk cotangent bundle
concepts.description: The total space of the cotangent bundle of a manifold restricted to vectors of bounded length, forming a symplectic manifold with boundary.

concepts.label: hyperbolic surface
concepts.description: A surface of negative constant curvature, geometrically realized as a quotient of the hyperbolic plane.

concepts.label: strong filling
concepts.description: A compact manifold with boundary that admits a compatible symplectic structure stronger than exact, allowing Liouville vector fields.

concepts.label: uniruled cap
concepts.description: A symplectic manifold covering a contact manifold where the adjunction formula admits a uniruled geometric structure.

concepts.label: adjunction cap
concepts.description: A symplectic cap constructed using adjunction formulas to control curvature and topology of exact fillings.

concepts.label: Stein fillable contact structure
concepts.description: A contact 3-manifold admitting a filling by a Stein complex surface, a complex manifold with strict plurisubharmonic exhaustion function.

concepts.label: Betti number
concepts.description: Topological invariant counting the dimension of homology groups, measuring the number of independent cycles in a manifold.

concepts.label: integral homology
concepts.description: Homology groups with integer coefficients, capturing the torsion-free and torsion components of a space's topology.

concepts.label: intersection form
concepts.description: A bilinear form on the homology of an even-dimensional manifold measuring geometric intersection multiplicity of cycles.

concepts.label: finiteness property
concepts.description: A topological constraint guaranteeing that exact or strong fillings of a contact manifold have uniformly bounded Betti numbers.

concepts.label: complexity zero
concepts.description: A restriction on uniruled/adjunction contact structures indicating maximal geometric rigidity with minimal deformations.

concepts.label: Dynkin diagram
concepts.description: A connected graph encoding the structure and classification of Coxeter groups and root systems.

concepts.label: Dynkin complex
concepts.description: A chain complex constructed from a D-algebra A to control deformations of quasi-Coxeter algebra structures.

concepts.label: Quasi-Coxeter algebra
concepts.description: An algebra structure on a group algebra generalising Coxeter group algebra with deformation properties controlled by Dynkin cohomology.

concepts.label: Cohomology of Dynkin complex
concepts.description: The cohomology groups H*(CD(A)) measuring obstructions to deformations and rigidity of quasi-Coxeter algebra structures.

concepts.label: Group algebra
concepts.description: The vector space with basis given by group elements and multiplication inherited from the group, denoted kW for group W over field k.

concepts.label: Parabolic subgroup
concepts.description: A subgroup of a Coxeter group generated by a subset of the standard generators, indexed by subgraphs of the Dynkin diagram.

concepts.label: Coxeter complex
concepts.description: A polyhedral complex whose combinatorics encode the structure of a Coxeter group and its parabolic subgroups.

concepts.label: Top cohomology
concepts.description: The highest-degree non-vanishing cohomology group H^n(CD(A)) of the Dynkin complex.

concepts.label: Filtration by vertex count
concepts.description: A grading of the Dynkin complex by the number of vertices in subgraphs of D, used to compute cohomology via spectral sequences.

concepts.label: Affine Coxeter group
concepts.description: A Coxeter group of affine type, acting cocompactly on Euclidean space; characterized by an affine Dynkin diagram.

concepts.label: symplectic Calabi-Yau 4-manifold
concepts.description: A 4-dimensional symplectic manifold with vanishing first Chern class, admitting a compatible symplectic structure and complex geometry.

concepts.label: cyclic action
concepts.description: An action by a cyclic finite group, generated by a single element of finite order.

concepts.label: symplectic surface
concepts.description: A 2-dimensional symplectic submanifold embedded in a higher-dimensional symplectic manifold.

concepts.label: bundle structure
concepts.description: A fiber bundle decomposition of a manifold as a total space fibred over a base space with fixed fiber type.

concepts.label: homological analysis
concepts.description: Study of topological and geometric properties via homology and cohomology groups, often graded by dimension.

concepts.label: disjoint embedding
concepts.description: An embedding of geometric objects into a manifold such that their images have empty intersection.

concepts.label: topology of manifolds
concepts.description: The study of global geometric and topological invariants—homology, Chern classes, fundamental group—characterizing manifold families.

concepts.label: N=2 supersymmetry
concepts.description: Effective supergravity with two supercharges, characteristic of type II string compactifications on CY3.

concepts.label: topological equivalence
concepts.description: Property that two phases or geometric configurations possess the same topological invariants (Hodge numbers, Euler characteristic, etc.).

concepts.label: mass-squared difference
concepts.description: Squared difference between neutrino mass eigenstates; Δm²₃₂, Δm²₂₁, Δm²₃₁ drive oscillation frequencies.

concepts.label: long baseline experiment
concepts.description: Neutrino oscillation measurement spanning baseline distance exceeding 1000 km, enabling sensitivity to multiple mass-squared differences and CP phase.

concepts.label: water Cherenkov detector
concepts.description: Underground detector using megaton-scale water volumes to observe Cherenkov radiation from charged particles produced by neutrino interactions.

concepts.label: proton beam
concepts.description: High-intensity 1 MW proton source at Brookhaven AGS that produces pions decaying into neutrinos for the oscillation experiment.

concepts.label: appearance channel
concepts.description: Oscillation measurement where neutrinos change flavor between source and detector; ν_μ → ν_e appearance is the primary CP-sensitive channel.

concepts.label: disappearance channel
concepts.description: Oscillation measurement where neutrinos of the same flavor deplete; ν_μ → ν_μ disappearance measures θ₂₃ and Δm²₃₂.

concepts.label: antineutrino mode
concepts.description: Running configuration with anti-neutrinos instead of neutrinos, enabling measurement of mass hierarchy via sign of Δm²₃₁.

concepts.label: LMA region
concepts.description: Large Mixing Angle solution for solar neutrino oscillations, corresponding to Δm²₂₁ ≈ 7.5 × 10⁻⁵ eV², measurable via ν_μ → ν_e appearance.

concepts.label: Glashow resonance
concepts.description: Resonant interaction of electron antineutrinos with electrons at threshold energy ~6.3 PeV, producing a W boson; provides distinctive signature for astrophysical antineutrino detection.

concepts.label: ultrahigh energy neutrino telescopes
concepts.description: Large-scale detectors designed to observe neutrinos from astrophysical sources at energies above 10^17 eV, using Earth's atmosphere or water/ice as target medium.

concepts.label: astrophysical neutrino sources
concepts.description: Distant cosmic objects (supernovae, active galactic nuclei, gamma-ray bursts, jets) that produce copious neutrinos through hadronic interactions and beta decay.

concepts.label: neutrino production mechanism
concepts.description: Physical process in astrophysical sources generating neutrinos, including leptogenesis, hadronic interactions, and flavor-mixing processes; constrains predicted neutrino flavor composition.

concepts.label: antineutrino detection
concepts.description: Observational process of identifying electron antineutrinos via charged-current interactions with electrons, exploiting characteristic energy signatures and event morphology.

concepts.label: neutrino flavor oscillation
concepts.description: Quantum mechanical phenomenon where neutrino mass eigenstates interfere during propagation, causing periodic conversion between flavor eigenstates; depends sensitively on mixing angles.

concepts.label: resonance energy window
concepts.description: Narrow energy range (~1 PeV width around 6.3 PeV) where Glashow resonance is kinematically accessible and resonance cross-section peaks.

concepts.label: solar neutrinos
concepts.description: Electron neutrinos produced in the Sun's core via nuclear fusion reactions and detected on Earth.

concepts.label: atmospheric neutrinos
concepts.description: Neutrinos produced by cosmic ray interactions in Earth's atmosphere, providing a natural beam for oscillation studies.

concepts.label: neutrino oscillation experiments
concepts.description: Detection experiments measuring flavor transformation signatures in natural or accelerator-produced neutrino beams.

concepts.label: detector sensitivity
concepts.description: Capability of an experiment to measure oscillation parameters and physics signatures through event reconstruction and statistical analysis.

concepts.label: three-flavor neutrino mixing
concepts.description: The framework describing oscillations among electron, muon, and tau neutrinos via the PMNS matrix with three mixing angles and one CP-violating phase.

concepts.label: Neutrino Factory
concepts.description: A proposed accelerator facility producing intense beams of muon neutrinos and antineutrinos via muon decay in a storage ring for precision long-baseline neutrino oscillation experiments.

concepts.label: Beta Beam facility
concepts.description: A proposed accelerator facility producing neutrino beams from beta decay of accelerated radioactive nuclei (typically ⁶He or ¹⁸Ne) for long-baseline oscillation measurements.

concepts.label: long-baseline oscillation experiment
concepts.description: Measurement of neutrino flavor conversion over kilometer-scale distances to probe mixing parameters and mass hierarchy.

concepts.label: accelerator R&D
concepts.description: Research and development of accelerator technologies and components required to design and construct next-generation neutrino-production facilities.

concepts.label: muon storage ring
concepts.description: A circular accelerator in which muons are stored and decay to produce neutrino beams; central technology for the Neutrino Factory.

concepts.label: neutrino beam production
concepts.description: Generation of intense, directional neutrino fluxes via decay of accelerated particles (muons, pions, or beta-emitting nuclei).

concepts.label: oscillation sensitivity
concepts.description: The precision and statistical power to measure neutrino oscillation parameters and discover unknown parameters like θ₁₃ or the mass hierarchy.

concepts.label: detector technology
concepts.description: Experimental apparatus for recording neutrino interactions and reconstructing event kinematics to infer flavor and energy.

concepts.label: symmetry group condition
concepts.description: A mathematical constraint derived from discrete flavor symmetry that directly relates lepton mixing parameters without explicit model construction.

concepts.label: model building
concepts.description: Explicit construction of particle physics models incorporating specific field content and interactions to realize desired mass and mixing patterns.

concepts.label: bimaximal mixing
concepts.description: A neutrino mixing pattern where the mixing matrix elements satisfy specific symmetry conditions, approximated by θ₁₂ ≈ 45° and θ₂₃ ≈ 45°, corrected by Cabibbo-order perturbations.

concepts.label: S4 group
concepts.description: The symmetric group of order 24, the symmetry group of the tetrahedron; used as a discrete flavour symmetry for leptons.

concepts.label: Cabibbo angle
concepts.description: The quark mixing angle θc ≈ 13.04°, used here as a typical scale for small corrections to leading-order mixing patterns.

concepts.label: lopsided mass matrices
concepts.description: Asymmetric texture in Yukawa coupling matrices where entries have hierarchically disparate magnitudes, naturally suppressing certain mixing angles.

concepts.label: Higgs representations
concepts.description: Representations of SO(10) Higgs fields (specifically 10 and 120) whose vacuum expectation values generate Yukawa couplings and mass hierarchies.

concepts.label: baryogenesis
concepts.description: Generation of the matter-antimatter asymmetry (baryon asymmetry parameter Y_B) through sphaleron conversion of leptogenesis.

concepts.label: scatter plot analysis
concepts.description: Parameter space exploration varying input parameters to map predicted ranges of mixing angles and CP phase, visualizing correlations.

concepts.label: imaginary axis constraint
concepts.description: Restriction of complex parameters to purely imaginary values (Im[parameter] ≠ 0, Re[parameter] = 0), reducing parameter space dimensionality.

concepts.label: SU(2) horizontal symmetry
concepts.description: Family symmetry acting on generations of quarks and leptons to constrain flavor mixing angles.

concepts.label: theta_12
concepts.description: Solar neutrino mixing angle governing solar neutrino oscillations and matter effects.

concepts.label: weak neutral currents
concepts.description: Flavor-diagonal weak interactions mediated by Z boson, constraining the algebra of electroweak symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Majorana CP phases
concepts.description: Complex phases α and β appearing in the neutrino mixing matrix UPMNS that arise from diagonalisation of the Majorana mass matrix and affect neutrinoless double beta decay.

concepts.label: neutrino mixing matrix
concepts.description: Unitary matrix UPMNS relating flavour eigenstates to mass eigenstates in the lepton sector, parametrised by three mixing angles and CP-violating phases.

concepts.label: tri-bimaximal mixing
concepts.description: Symmetry-based form of the neutrino mixing matrix with θ₁₂ = arcsin(1/√3), θ₂₃ = 45°, θ₁₃ = 0, now disfavoured by precision measurements.

concepts.label: CP invariance
concepts.description: Symmetry under combined charge conjugation and parity in the neutrino sector; generalised CP invariance imposes constraints on Majorana phases.

concepts.label: mass matrix diagonalisation
concepts.description: Unitary transformation decomposing a Hermitian mass matrix into diagonal form with real eigenvalues; introduces CP phases in the transforming matrices.

concepts.label: neutrino mass generation
concepts.description: Mechanism producing non-zero neutrino masses and Majorana nature through physics beyond the Standard Model, constrained by CP symmetries and discrete flavour symmetries.

concepts.label: vertical family symmetry
concepts.description: Symmetry relating different representations or scales within the electroweak hierarchy, often constraining the fermion mass spectrum.

concepts.label: MSW effect
concepts.description: Mikheyev-Smirnov-Wolfenstein mechanism enabling resonant conversion of solar electron neutrinos to other flavours through matter interactions; explains solar neutrino deficit.

concepts.label: SU(9) family unification
concepts.description: Gauged unification model treating quark and lepton families as components of a larger SU(9) symmetry group.

concepts.label: Standard Model extension
concepts.description: Minimal or non-minimal modification to the SM Lagrangian introducing new fields or symmetries to address observational anomalies.

concepts.label: lepton family symmetry
concepts.description: Symmetry principle restricting interactions between different lepton generations to explain flavor structure and mixing patterns.

concepts.label: minimal extension
concepts.description: SM modification with the fewest additional fields or symmetries required to explain a given physical phenomenon.

concepts.label: SU(3) gauge family symmetry
concepts.description: Non-Abelian gauge symmetry acting on lepton families to generate flavor structure and CP violation patterns.

concepts.label: lepton-flavor mixing
concepts.description: Unitary transformation relating flavor eigenstates to mass eigenstates in the leptonic sector; described by the MNSP matrix.

concepts.label: Majorana neutrino
concepts.description: Massive neutral lepton that is its own antiparticle; permits lepton-number violation and neutrinoless double-beta decay.

concepts.label: charged-lepton mixing
concepts.description: Unitary transformation in the charged-lepton sector; exhibits hierarchy structure similar to the quark sector when U(1) family symmetries are approximate.

concepts.label: maximal spontaneous CP violation
concepts.description: Configuration where CP asymmetry arises from vacuum alignment rather than fundamental parameters; achieves maximal Jarlskog invariant.

concepts.label: reactor neutrino
concepts.description: Electron antineutrinos produced in nuclear fission chains within reactor cores, used as a precision probe of oscillation parameters.

concepts.label: CHOOZ experiment
concepts.description: Reactor neutrino experiment providing the most stringent upper limit on θ₁₃ prior to the new generation of measurements.

concepts.label: Double Chooz
concepts.description: Two-detector reactor neutrino experiment in France designed to measure θ₁₃ with improved sensitivity.

concepts.label: Daya Bay
concepts.description: Reactor neutrino experiment in China aiming to measure θ₁₃ using multiple baselines and detectors.

concepts.label: RENO
concepts.description: Reactor experiment for neutrino oscillation in South Korea designed to search for θ₁₃.

concepts.label: Angra
concepts.description: Reactor neutrino experiment in Brazil contributing to global θ₁₃ measurement efforts.

concepts.label: two-detector method
concepts.description: Experimental strategy using multiple detectors at different distances from a neutrino source to isolate oscillation effects.

concepts.label: neutrino mass dominance
concepts.description: A quantity introduced to tag neutrino flavor by identifying which mass eigenstate dominates a given flavor eigenstate.

concepts.label: neutrino flavor eigenstate
concepts.description: Weak eigenstate of neutrinos produced in weak interactions; a superposition of mass eigenstates.

concepts.label: neutrino mass eigenstate
concepts.description: Eigenstate of the neutrino Hamiltonian with definite propagation mass; a superposition of flavor eigenstates.

concepts.label: maximal doublet mixing
concepts.description: A configuration in which two neutrino doublets mix with 45° angles, maximizing flavor-mass transitions.

concepts.label: mixing angle theta
concepts.description: First neutrino mixing parameter controlling transitions between flavor and mass eigenstates.

concepts.label: mixing angle phi
concepts.description: Second neutrino mixing parameter in the four-neutrino model; related to theta via charged lepton masses.

concepts.label: SNO detector
concepts.description: Solar Neutrino Observatory: water Cherenkov detector sensitive to neutrino flavor via charged current, neutral current, and elastic scattering channels.

concepts.label: Super-Kamiokande detector
concepts.description: Large underground water Cherenkov detector measuring neutrino oscillations and rare processes; key source of atmospheric neutrino data.

concepts.label: golden ratio mixing
concepts.description: Lepton mixing pattern incorporating the golden ratio φ ≈ 1.618 in mixing angles; alternative predictive texture beyond tribimaximal.

concepts.label: sequential dominance
concepts.description: Mechanism where neutrino mass eigenvalues are generated sequentially by dominance of individual heavy states in see-saw formula; produces specific mass orderings.

concepts.label: residual trimaximal mixing
concepts.description: Residual discrete symmetry preserved in neutrino or charged lepton sector after flavon breaking, yielding characteristic mixing patterns with partial maximality.

concepts.label: charged lepton correction
concepts.description: Deviation of PMNS mixing from pure neutrino-sector prediction due to non-trivial CKM-like corrections from charged lepton mass matrix diagonalization.

concepts.label: mixing sum rule
concepts.description: Relation among PMNS angles (e.g., solar or atmospheric sum rules) derived from discrete symmetries; constrains model predictions.

concepts.label: finite group theory
concepts.description: Mathematical framework of finite discrete groups (A₄, S₄, Δ(96), D_n) used to classify and construct family symmetry models.

concepts.label: A₄ symmetry
concepts.description: Alternating group of order 12, tetrahedral point group; widely used discrete family symmetry predicting tribimaximal mixing when fully realized.

concepts.label: S₄ symmetry
concepts.description: Symmetric group of order 24, octahedral point group; discrete family symmetry larger than A₄, allowing richer model building and correction mechanisms.

concepts.label: Δ(96) symmetry
concepts.description: Finite discrete group of order 96 with non-Abelian structure; provides flexibility in constructing GUT+family-symmetry models with realistic mixing.

concepts.label: neutrino
concepts.description: Fundamental fermion weakly interacting with matter, characterized by tiny mass and three flavor states (electron, muon, tau).

concepts.label: reactor monitoring
concepts.description: Non-intrusive surveillance of nuclear reactor operation and fuel composition via antineutrino emission.

concepts.label: nuclear fission
concepts.description: Splitting of heavy nuclei (e.g. U-235, Pu-239) releasing energy and producing radioactive decay chains that emit antineutrinos.

concepts.label: IAEA verification
concepts.description: International Atomic Energy Agency's mandate to monitor and control nuclear power plants for non-proliferation and safety compliance.

concepts.label: applied neutrino physics
concepts.description: Use of neutrino detection and properties for practical applications beyond fundamental physics research.

concepts.label: antineutrino signal
concepts.description: Observable flux and spectral signature of antineutrinos emanating from reactor core, encoding fuel burn-up and composition.

concepts.label: non-intrusive measurement
concepts.description: Detection technique that does not require physical access to or intervention in the monitored system.

concepts.label: nuclear power plant
concepts.description: Facility using controlled nuclear fission to generate electricity, producing intense antineutrino flux as a byproduct.

concepts.label: SU(3) subgroup
concepts.description: A discrete subgroup embedded in the SU(3) gauge or flavor group, defining the structure of the family symmetry.

concepts.label: Atmospheric neutrino mixing
concepts.description: The oscillation parameter governing the mixing between τ-type and μ-type neutrinos, measured to be nearly maximal (θ₂₃ ≈ 45°).

concepts.label: Solar neutrino mixing
concepts.description: The oscillation parameter governing the mixing between e-type and μ-type neutrinos, measured to be large (θ₁₂ ≈ 35°).

concepts.label: μ-τ symmetry
concepts.description: A discrete flavor symmetry permuting muon and tau leptons, predicting maximal atmospheric neutrino mixing θ₂₃ ≈ 45° and suppressed CHOOZ angle θ₁₃.

concepts.label: Friedberg-Lee symmetry
concepts.description: A discrete flavor symmetry acting on the effective Majorana neutrino mass operator, allowing oblique breaking while keeping the lightest neutrino massless.

concepts.label: Majorana neutrino mass operator
concepts.description: The dimension-five effective operator generating Majorana masses for left-handed neutrinos after electroweak symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: flavor mixing pattern
concepts.description: The structure of the quark (CKM) and lepton (PMNS) mixing matrices determining weak-interaction transitions between flavor eigenstates.

concepts.label: oblique symmetry breaking
concepts.description: A pattern of symmetry breaking where a global symmetry is broken at tree level but a protected massless eigenstate remains, preserving aspects of the original symmetry.

concepts.label: θ₁₃ prediction
concepts.description: An explicit formula relating the CHOOZ angle to other mixing angles and symmetry parameters: sin θ₁₃ = tan θ₁₂ |(1 − tan θ₂₃)/(1 + tan θ₂₃)|.

concepts.label: cosmic neutrino telescope
concepts.description: High-energy astrophysical detector probing ultrahigh-energy cosmic neutrinos, sensitive to flavor mixing and rare processes.

concepts.label: Q_6 group
concepts.description: A dicyclic discrete group of order 12, used as the flavor symmetry in the constructed model.

concepts.label: μ-τ sector mixing
concepts.description: The large mixing angle observed between muon and tau flavors in lepton oscillations, as reported by SuperKamiokande.

concepts.label: discrete theta angle
concepts.description: Discrete topological parameter in string theory that can be turned on to generate new components of the moduli space while preserving supersymmetry.

concepts.label: gonality
concepts.description: The minimal degree of a covering map from a curve to the projective line; measures the complexity of the curve's geometry.

concepts.label: Clifford index
concepts.description: An invariant of a smooth curve measuring the minimal degree of a special linear system; bounded by (g-1)/2 for a curve of genus g.

concepts.label: complete linear system
concepts.description: The projective space of all divisors linearly equivalent to a fixed divisor; parametrizes all curves in a given family.

concepts.label: Clifford dimension
concepts.description: The codimension of the variety of special linear systems on a curve; equals 0 for hyperelliptic and plane curves.

concepts.label: nef line bundle
concepts.description: A line bundle with non-negative intersection with all curves; weaker than ample, used to classify embeddings.

concepts.label: birational very-ampleness
concepts.description: Property of a line bundle whose global sections give a birational embedding into projective space after a possible blow-up.

concepts.label: higher order embedding properties
concepts.description: Conditions on line bundles controlling the degree of embedding and separation of points/tangents in higher order jets.

concepts.label: smooth plane curve
concepts.description: A curve defined by a single polynomial equation in ℂℙ² with no singular points; universal example of exceptional curves.

concepts.label: hyperKähler rotation
concepts.description: Continuous family of metrics on a quaternionic-Kähler manifold parameterized by an S² of complex structures, interpolating between symplectic and complex limits.

concepts.label: integral affine structure
concepts.description: Atlas of charts with transition functions in Aff(ℤ) = GL(n,ℤ) ⋉ ℤⁿ, providing integral linear lattice structure on a topological manifold.

concepts.label: complex affine structure
concepts.description: Integral affine structure on the base of a special Lagrangian fibration, decorated with complex coordinates encoding monodromy and discriminant information.

concepts.label: Floer-theoretical mirror
concepts.description: Mirror variety constructed via Floer cohomology and Lagrangian vanishing cycles, dual to the original variety under symplectic mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: A∞-singularity
concepts.description: Hypersurface singularity of type {x²+y²+zⁿ=0}; ADE singularity corresponding to the cyclic group ℤ/n with non-Gorenstein structure.

concepts.label: smoothing of singularities
concepts.description: Deformation of a variety with singular points to a nearby smooth variety; moduli space of smoothings governed by obstructions.

concepts.label: monotone del Pezzo
concepts.description: del Pezzo surface whose Kähler form restricts to a monotone symplectic form on Lagrangian vanishing cycles.

concepts.label: local delta invariant
concepts.description: A stability threshold measuring the singularity of the anticanonical divisor at a point on a Fano variety.

concepts.label: degree 2 del Pezzo
concepts.description: A smooth del Pezzo surface with anticanonical divisor of degree 2; one of the nine discrete Fano classes.

concepts.label: rationality of invariant
concepts.description: The property that the local delta invariant takes a rational (or irrational) value at a prescribed point.

concepts.label: exceptional curve classification
concepts.description: The systematic enumeration of all (-1)-curves on a del Pezzo surface, determining its geometry.

concepts.label: K-stability
concepts.description: A notion of geometric stability of Fano varieties defined via positivity of the anticanonical divisor along test configurations.

concepts.label: quasi-F-splitting
concepts.description: A commutative algebra property in mixed characteristic that generalizes F-splitting from positive characteristic, used to establish vanishing theorems.

concepts.label: mixed characteristic
concepts.description: Algebraic geometry setting where a ring contains both zero and nonzero characteristic elements, typically in p-adic or arithmetic contexts.

concepts.label: Kodaira vanishing
concepts.description: A fundamental vanishing theorem for cohomology of line bundles on smooth varieties, stating that certain sheaf cohomology groups vanish under positivity conditions.

concepts.label: rational double point
concepts.description: Isolated singularities on algebraic surfaces that resolve to a union of smooth rational curves with specific intersection patterns; classified by ADE Dynkin diagrams.

concepts.label: smooth weak del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A smooth projective surface with numerically effective anticanonical divisor that is not ample; generalizes classical del Pezzo surfaces.

concepts.label: F-splitting
concepts.description: A positive characteristic commutative algebra condition where the Frobenius map splits as an algebra homomorphism; implies favorable vanishing properties.

concepts.label: lift
concepts.description: An algebraic geometry construction extending a variety or scheme from one base ring to another; typically lifting from characteristic p to mixed characteristic.

concepts.label: sheaf cohomology
concepts.description: A fundamental tool in algebraic geometry measuring global sections and higher cohomology groups of sheaves on varieties.

concepts.label: smooth quartic curve
concepts.description: A nonsingular algebraic curve of degree 4 in ℙ²; serves as the branch divisor for the coverings in this family.

concepts.label: Weyl group
concepts.description: The group generated by reflections through hyperplanes in a root system; acts on the configuration of lines on a del Pezzo surface.

concepts.label: unitary group
concepts.description: The group of unitary matrices U(n) preserving a Hermitian form; arithmetic lattices in U(n,1) act on the ball model of hyperbolic space.

concepts.label: quadratic form
concepts.description: A homogeneous polynomial of degree 2 in n variables; over number fields, quadratic forms classify arithmetic lattices via discriminant and signature.

concepts.label: branched cover family
concepts.description: A parametrized collection of cyclic branched covers where the branch divisor varies; the base space is the space of smooth quartic curves.

concepts.label: Springer fibre
concepts.description: Geometric fibre of the Springer resolution map over a nilpotent element in the Lie algebra of a reductive group.

concepts.label: exceptional simple group
concepts.description: One of the five exceptional Lie groups (G₂, F₄, E₆, E₇, E₈) not contained in the classical infinite families.

concepts.label: simply elliptic singularity
concepts.description: A singularity whose minimal resolution has fundamental group ℤ and whose canonical divisor is a multiple of the identity; elliptic surface singularity.

concepts.label: log resolution
concepts.description: Birational morphism that is an isomorphism outside the singular locus and makes the exceptional divisor a normal crossings divisor.

concepts.label: principal bundle
concepts.description: Fibre bundle with a Lie group G acting freely and transitively on each fibre, defined by a Lie group structure and local trivialisations.

concepts.label: stack of principal bundles
concepts.description: Stack parametrising principal G-bundles over a base scheme, incorporating automorphisms and deformations.

concepts.label: nilpotent cone
concepts.description: Closed subset of a Lie algebra 𝔤 consisting of all nilpotent elements, the base space for the Springer resolution.

concepts.label: Springer resolution
concepts.description: Geometric resolution of singularities of the nilpotent cone obtained by blowing up along the nilpotent elements, with Springer fibres as generic fibres.

concepts.label: weak del Pezzo fibration
concepts.description: A fibration whose fibers are weak del Pezzo surfaces, generalizing del Pezzo fibrations to allow rational singularities.

concepts.label: del Pezzo fibration
concepts.description: A fibration whose generic fibers are del Pezzo surfaces (Fano surfaces with K_X ample).

concepts.label: vertical cylinder
concepts.description: An algebraic cylinder (isomorphic to A^1 × C for some curve C) contained in a fibration, intersecting fibers transversally.

concepts.label: minimal weak del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A weak del Pezzo surface with no exceptional divisors that can be contracted without introducing singularities worse than rational.

concepts.label: generic fiber
concepts.description: The fiber of a fibration over a generic point of the base, representing the typical geometric structure.

concepts.label: cylinder
concepts.description: An affine algebraic variety isomorphic to A^1 × C, the product of the affine line with an algebraic curve.

concepts.label: characteristic zero
concepts.description: A field whose prime subfield is the rationals (or has no additive torsion), including all algebraically closed fields containing ℚ.

concepts.label: classification of weak del Pezzo surfaces
concepts.description: Complete determination of minimal weak del Pezzo surfaces over a field of characteristic zero by their degree and singularity data.

concepts.label: rational singularity
concepts.description: A singularity whose exceptional divisor set has zero arithmetic genus, arising naturally in del Pezzo surface contractions.

concepts.label: integral Lagrangian torus
concepts.description: A Lagrangian torus in a symplectic manifold whose relative area homomorphism is integer-valued.

concepts.label: Clifford torus
concepts.description: A specific embedded Lagrangian torus in projective spaces and Del Pezzo surfaces, defined as the product of circles of equal radius.

concepts.label: Lagrangian packing
concepts.description: A maximal disjoint collection of Lagrangian tori such that any other Lagrangian torus of the same type must intersect at least one torus in the collection.

concepts.label: relative area homomorphism
concepts.description: A homomorphism measuring the signed area enclosed by a Lagrangian submanifold relative to a reference symplectic form.

concepts.label: Hind-Kerman packing
concepts.description: A foundational result establishing the existence and maximality of Lagrangian torus packings in specific symplectic manifolds, extended in this work.

concepts.label: anticanonical bundle
concepts.description: The dual of the canonical bundle of a projective variety, whose ampleness characterizes Fano varieties like Del Pezzo surfaces.

concepts.label: disjoint collection
concepts.description: A family of geometric objects with no pairwise intersections, a key property of maximal Lagrangian packings.

concepts.label: sections of fibration
concepts.description: Global morphisms from the base curve into a fibred variety that map each point to a point in the corresponding fibre.

concepts.label: Movable Bend and Break
concepts.description: Lemma establishing that moving families of rational curves in a fibration exhibit controlled deformation and specialization behaviour, enabling curve classification.

concepts.label: Geometric Manin's Conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture predicting the asymptotic growth rate and distribution of rational points on Fano varieties via geometric invariants.

concepts.label: counting function
concepts.description: Function enumerating rational or algebraic curves of bounded height or degree on a variety, subject to geometric constraints.

concepts.label: enumerativity
concepts.description: Property that a curve-counting invariant equals the expected geometric count without excess or deficiency from non-transverse intersections.

concepts.label: rational curves
concepts.description: Algebraic curves isomorphic to the projective line ℙ¹, characterized by genus zero and parametrizable by a single coordinate.

concepts.label: canonical singularities
concepts.description: Singularities of varieties satisfying the condition that the relative canonical divisor pulls back with non-negative coefficients under any resolution.

concepts.label: unipotent group action
concepts.description: Action of a unipotent algebraic group (like the additive group Ga) on an affine or projective variety.

concepts.label: affine algebraic variety
concepts.description: A subset of affine space defined by polynomial equations, equipped with the Zariski topology.

concepts.label: singularity type
concepts.description: Classification of singular points of a variety by local algebraic invariants such as multiplicity and resolution data.

concepts.label: rational section
concepts.description: A morphism from the base curve to the total space of a fibration, selecting a rational point in each fiber; sections parametrize geometric solutions.

concepts.label: Movable Bend and Break Lemma
concepts.description: A technique for classifying rational sections of fibrations by inductively breaking families of movable curves; yields bounds on section behavior.

concepts.label: rational points
concepts.description: Points on algebraic varieties defined over the ground field, central to Diophantine geometry and height bounds.

concepts.label: function field
concepts.description: The field of rational functions on a variety; del Pezzo surfaces over function fields of curves are the main objects of study.

concepts.label: birational morphism
concepts.description: A morphism that is an isomorphism outside a lower-dimensional subset; used to relate del Pezzo surfaces to standard forms.

concepts.label: split del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A del Pezzo surface admitting a morphism (over the ground field) to projective space, making its geometry explicitly representable.

concepts.label: ground field
concepts.description: The base field over which algebraic varieties and morphisms are defined; controls which geometric structures are rational.

concepts.label: Mori fibre space
concepts.description: A terminal variety with a contraction to a lower-dimensional base whose general fibres are Fano; the canonical output structure from the minimal model program.

concepts.label: minimal model program
concepts.description: A foundational algorithm in birational geometry that transforms any variety into a minimal model or Mori fibre space through a sequence of divisorial contractions and flips.

concepts.label: irrational variety
concepts.description: A variety that is not birational to projective space; established as a consequence of birational rigidity for certain del Pezzo fibrations.

concepts.label: K²-condition
concepts.description: An explicit numerical or geometric condition imposed on del Pezzo fibrations ensuring they satisfy generality and technicality hypotheses for rigidity.

concepts.label: projective line base
concepts.description: The ℙ¹ base of a del Pezzo fibration; the one-dimensional parameter space over which del Pezzo surfaces are fibered.

concepts.label: smooth total space
concepts.description: The property that the total space of a fibration is smooth; a regularity condition required for rigidity proofs.

concepts.label: birationally rigid del Pezzo fibration
concepts.description: A del Pezzo fibration satisfying the conditions of the paper whose Mori fibre space structure is unique and not birational to Fano or conic bundles.

concepts.label: del Pezzo degree
concepts.description: A numerical invariant d = (-K_X)² of a del Pezzo surface X, where K_X is the canonical divisor; ranges from 1 to 9.

concepts.label: twisted cylinder
concepts.description: A generalization of a vertical cylinder in a threefold del Pezzo fibration over P¹ with nontrivial twisting.

concepts.label: affine line
concepts.description: The one-dimensional affine space A¹, the simplest cylinder factor appearing in cylinder structures.

concepts.label: quasi-projective variety
concepts.description: An algebraic variety that is an open subset of a projective variety; admits both affine and projective structures.

concepts.label: threefold del Pezzo fibration
concepts.description: A del Pezzo fibration π : V → P¹ where V is a three-dimensional variety with fibers of degree d ≤ 4.

concepts.label: degree 1 del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A del Pezzo surface with anticanonical divisor of self-intersection number 1; the most singular among del Pezzo surfaces.

concepts.label: terminal singularities
concepts.description: Mild singularities appearing in the minimal model program with discrepancy greater than zero.

concepts.label: Kodaira classification
concepts.description: Classification scheme for singular fibers in elliptic fibrations by their monodromy and dual graph structure.

concepts.label: elliptic singular fiber
concepts.description: A singular fiber in an elliptic fibration characterized by its type in Kodaira's classification (I₀, Iₙ, II, III, IV, etc.).

concepts.label: del Pezzo surface singularities
concepts.description: Singularities occurring on degree 1 del Pezzo surfaces; their structure constrains the singular fiber types in fibrations.

concepts.label: stable rationality
concepts.description: A variety is stably rational if a product with some projective space becomes rational after birational modification.

concepts.label: fibration degree
concepts.description: The degree of the anticanonical divisor on the generic fibre, classifying del Pezzo fibrations: degree 1, 2, or 3.

concepts.label: very general member
concepts.description: A member of a parameter family outside countably many proper closed subsets, generically avoiding special loci.

concepts.label: rationality obstruction
concepts.description: A geometric or cohomological invariant that prevents a variety from being rational or stably rational.

concepts.label: higher-dimensional generalisation
concepts.description: Extension of results from 3-dimensional varieties to higher-dimensional del Pezzo fibrations over projective spaces.

concepts.label: multiple fibers
concepts.description: Fibers of a fibration that appear with multiplicity > 1 in the divisor class, corresponding to ramification loci of the fibration map.

concepts.label: fiber multiplicity
